Title: Inaccurate
Content: After using the RingConn Gen2 for one week I find it to be inaccurate in many aspects particularly step count as compared to both my Apple Watch and iPhone. Title: It's early but overall very satisfied
Content:
Over all I am very satisfied with the ring. It doesn't have more bells & whistles than necessary. I wish the app was a bit more customizable. I talked to customer service a couple of times for clarification- first time the representative made me feel very confident that the answers they gave were correct. Second time a little different experience but not enough to keep me from ordering. My questions were if the actual ring was the same size as the sizing kit or slightly smaller or bigger. Told slightly smaller, when I got the ring it was actually slightly bigger, very slightly. I went with the size that the sizer was slightly difficult to get over my knuckle. Would have preferred a 1/2 size but informed not available, doesn't hurt to ask. Actual ring slides a bit too easy a 1/2 size smaller would have been perfect.
Look forward using this for a lot longer than I used my Fitbit charge6.

Title: Great ring overall! Just needs some improvements in monitoring workouts.
Content:
This has been a great smart ring! The price is right and I love that the app and plethora of data are both free. The first ring I received was not tracking vitals properly, but RingConn was responsive and sent a replacement ring (it did take a couple of weeks). This ring has been consistently tracking data and I love how many graphs are provided for interpretation. It seems to do a good job with step tracking (at least for trends), but it struggles to accurately monitor my heart rate during rowing workouts. I have automatic workout mode detection on and even set it to an indoor cycling workout, but my heart rate is rarely registers above 110 bpm. It does much better during running workouts.

Women’s health cycle tracking was one of my main reasons for purchasing. It’s very simple, but temperature shifts was all I needed, so this does the job just fine.

Overall, I would definitely recommend the ring!

Title: Looooooove my ring
Content: Looooooove my ring! I switched from an Apple Watch and it was the best decision ever. My watch was dying all the time and I truly was over getting notifications on my wrist all day but enjoyed the health tracking aspects so kept wearing it. But the ring is sooooo much better. I love tracking my sleep and my cycle. I get excited to wake up and check my sleep score every day. The battery life is amazing. I’ve had the ring about 2 months now and I’ve charged it 3 times for about 30 minutes each and that is all. I also get compliments all the time on how thin the ring is and how my friends with the other big brand wish they had done more research and got this one. 10/10 recommend!

Title: Urgently needed improvements
Content:
Good points:
Useful data,
Long battery life,
Easy to handle ring,

What’s missing:
Überblick der fünf vitalzeichen (german)
I don’t see a possibility to visualize historic data diagrams for (Day, week, month, year) of the five vital values (vitalzeichen)

What’s to Much:
The textual explanations are boring. Permanently repeating the same Text modules. I do not need them, But I can’t disable them, Please change it.

I can’t disable Messages from Rincon, That I’m too long in bed and not moving.
But I’m just reading and working.

Accuracy
the heart rate measurement bpm It’s not reacting fast enough while In training mode. It should permanently measure my heart so that I can know when I should slow down. My Apple Watch reacts much faster when my heart rate increases or decreases again due to greater exertion during training. I wouldn’t bother if the battery life would be much shorter through training sessions.

Title: Exceptional Product and Customer Service – A Truly Outstanding Experience
Content:
I've been a dedicated supporter of RingConn since December 2022, initially backing them through their Indiegogo campaign. From the very beginning, their communication has been nothing short of excellent—clear, consistent, and timely.

Over time, I've watched the RingConn Android app evolve through multiple updates, each bringing meaningful improvements. The biometric insights provided by the ring have been both valuable and informative, helping me better understand and monitor my health.

When RingConn released Version 2 of their smart ring in September 2024, I didn’t hesitate to place an order. The purchasing experience was seamless, and once again, their communication throughout the process was top-tier.

In April 2025, I reached out to their customer support team with a question. I was blown away—not only does RingConn offer what I believe to be the best smart ring on the market (especially considering its competitive price, lack of a subscription fee, and robust health tracking features), but their customer support is truly outstanding. Their responses were prompt, clear, and reliable. Most impressively, when they say they’ll follow up—they actually do.

My experience with both the product and the support team has far exceeded my expectations. I wholeheartedly recommend RingConn to anyone looking for a high-quality smart ring backed by exceptional service.

Title: A sleek ring with great features
Content:
I’ve been using the RingConn Gen 2 Smart Ring for several weeks now, and I am very happy with it. I never expected the ring to be perfect and there is nothing like a visit to your healthcare provider however, with my experience using the RingConn, I am very satisfied with the close to accurate information I get. The information it provides me keeps me on track with my wellness goals. I especially like the sleep feature, which allows me to see my sleeping patterns and how to improve them. The ring provides various features and although I might not utilize them all, I am glad they are available. I did research on the different health rings available in the market and felt that this particular model of ring would best suit my needs.
The RingConn Gen 2 Smart Ring is a compelling choice for those seeking a high quality health monitoring device without the burden of subscription fees. Its exceptional battery life, comfortable design, and health tracking features make it a worthwhile purchase. While I have experienced some limitations in fitness tracking the overall value it offers has far exceeded my expectations.

Title: Worth the very long wait.
Content:
From ordering to receiving took over six weeks.
Initially the ring sizer kit arrives then when size is confirmed your actual ring arrives.
Ring is great, charges very quickly, light and attractive design and the data it collects is accurate and really useful to improve health.
The sleep monitoring is fascinating and explains why I feel like I do when I wake up.
Thoroughly recommended.

Title: Love this ring!
Content: Love this ring! Process was super easy to get the right size. You place your order, they send you a ring sizing kit if you need one, you wear the sizer ring for at least a day to make sure it’s comfortable, then go back to your orders and mark which size you’d like and they ship it to you. The first 3 days I did their sleep apnea tracking and it worked wonderfully. Very cool to see all of the insights as someone with sleep apnea. I wear it daily to track my heart rate as I have a condition called POTS. This seems to be the only ring that constantly tracks your heart rate even when not exercising. Battery life is amazing. All in all it’s a great product!

Title: Not Accurate
Content: I went with this primarily for step tracking and sleep information. I've found when I wake up it already has 100+ steps (I don't sleepwalk or get up to go to the bathroom) and I question whether the step count is accurate during the day as well- it always seems very high. And the sleep must be based on being horizontal? I was recently traveling and got some great, long sleep on some plane rides but the ring totally missed it. And then it counted a massage as my being completely asleep. I may have dozed off for a minute or two lol but definitely did not sleep through the whole thing. I took it off after that and haven't been inclined to wear it again. A bummer though, it's expensive and I am interested in tracking this information!

Title: Liars and a scam
Content:
My ring was having problems getting correct data readings. I contacted customer service by email because the phone number goes straight to voicemail and they do not call you back.
For 3 weeks, I had a gen 1 ring and after a week of talking they offered me $100 a gen 2 ring, so I picked one the gen 2 air. They came back and said that offer was $50, I told them they didn't specify which one so they can't do that. Days later they email me and tell me they will send it for free. They confirmed my address twice and nothing. So the next email they wanted me to send back the old one first and then they would send the new one. That came out of nowhere and they had never said this before. I advised I was not comfortable with that since all the problems so far. We confirmed my address again and they said they would ship it right away with a return slip for the other one inside. That was a week ago and still nothing, so I have to email again
I also started to screen shot the emails as I noticed they were deleting some where they stated things they promised they were going to do and never did.
This company is a scam, bunch of liars, and all you will get is emails to appease you. If you don't constantly email them sometimes 2 and 3 times a day cause your haven't gotten a response they just send you another email of something else they want you to do that was never part of the discussion. Don't spend $300 to have.issues cause you will never get them fixed. It is now May 5th, so 1 month later and still nothing.

Title: I never received the ring so this is more a review of ordering and support
Content:
I ordered a stainless steel-colored ring for my wife’s birthday. When the sizing kit arrived, it included not only ring sizers but also color samples. After reviewing them, my wife decided she preferred the rose gold option. I reached out to customer support to change the selection, but they advised me to cancel the original order and place a new one for the rose gold version.

I followed their instructions and placed a new order. However, after a lengthy shipping process, I received a package containing a sleep mask and an aromatherapy kit—no ring. I contacted support again, and while they did investigate with the shipping provider and issued a refund, I was left scrambling to find a replacement birthday gift.

In the end, after more than a month, two orders were charged and refunded, and I received a package of unrelated items. I’m genuinely shocked at how disorganized and unreliable their order fulfillment process has been.
CleanText: i ordered a stainless steelcolored ring for my wifes birthday when the sizing kit arrived it included not only ring sizers but also color samples after reviewing them my wife decided she preferred the rose gold option i reached out to customer support to change the selection but they advised me to cancel the original order and place a new one for the rose gold version i followed their instructions and placed a new order however after a lengthy shipping process i received a package containing a sleep mask and an aromatherapy kitno ring i contacted support again and while they did investigate with the shipping provider and issued a refund i was left scrambling to find a replacement birthday gift in the end after more than a month two orders were charged and refunded and i received a package of unrelated items im genuinely shocked at how disorganized and unreliable their order fulfillment process has been

Title: Helpful data for wellness goals
Content: The ring sizer kit showed up fast and was easy to use, the actual ring took a while as it shipped from china. The ring fits perfectly and the data it gives in the app is really helpful. Especially for balancing your wellness. The battery life lasts about 10 days. I tried a cheaper one that didn’t provide as much granular data, and it broke within 6 months- this is a massive upgrade from that, though I’ve only had it for a month, so we’ll see if it continues to work. Overall I’m really happy with it and would recommend it, especially if you find sleeping in your watch/tracker to be awkward.

Title: Half met value proposition - rn its not helping me at all, data not curated / analyzed enough to be useful
Content:
- data not accuracy enough
- dont be afraid to use user insights for data accuracy, make them part of your analysis, even though its subjective, it can add great value and most of users would love to input as much insights as possible. Ponder it accordingly.

- ai chat is pretty unusful rn, but i hope you keep adding functionality including being able to input my own questions.
- want an ai that does more than give me metrics and percentages, i want to interpret them, wanna ask questions and get to know my body and brain better, thats the hole point.

- provide tips / recommendations / solutions, ok my deep sleep has not met its goal ever, ok how do i fix that, and also, why is it important, where am i seeing its effects?

- wanna be able to input data such as:
caffeine & water intake, wether, been outside or not, felt grateful or not, motivated?, inspired?, emotions and our own subjective interpretations!!!!!
You have to be able to mix both my own knowledge about my mind and body and your own objective physical analysis and pattern detection into curated and analyzed useful data, thats the point, thats the solution u should provide

Title: Not accurate, lots of issues
Content: The ring does not automatically track exercise as it claims. There are also very limited types of exercise you can log and it can’t be done after the fact. It also does not accurately track heart rate during exercise and maxes out around 135bpm. It also then flags elevated heart rate during exercise as an outlier which affects your health score. Step tracking is also not accurate. Basically a glorified sleep tracker and with the other issues not sure I can trust even that. Probably would not have purchased if I’d have known about this issues. I’m hoping that with continued wear it will at least be an accurate menstrual cycle tracker.
CleanText: the ring does not automatically track exercise as it claims there are also very limited types of exercise you can log and it cant be done after the fact it also does not accurately track heart rate during exercise and maxes out around bpm it also then flags elevated heart rate during exercise as an outlier which affects your health score step tracking is also not accurate basically a glorified sleep tracker and with the other issues not sure i can trust even that probably would not have purchased if id have known about this issues im hoping that with continued wear it will at least be an accurate menstrual cycle tracker

Title: Best Customer Service
Content: The RingConn Customer Service Team has gone above and beyond to make my experience great. Due to the Canada Post strike, I was delayed getting my sizing kit prior to leaving on a trip, and they were accommodating and understanding of the delay. By the time I had returned, the rose gold colour had been released, and I wished to change my original order. They helped me cancel the old order, place a new one, AND honoured my original discount code. They were friendly, polite and made this the best customer service experience I have ever had.

Title: Great user interface, accurate metrics, great after sales support.
Content: I’ve been using the RingConn2 smart ring and have been really impressed so far. The app interface is clean, intuitive, and easy to navigate, making it simple to track my health metrics. The measurements—especially sleep and heart rate—seem accurate and consistent, which gives me confidence in the data. A big shoutout to their after-sales support as well—responsive, helpful, and genuinely focused on customer satisfaction. Overall, it’s a sleek and reliable wearable that blends seamlessly into daily life.

Content: I looked at all the smart ring options and took a chance last year with RingConn. A newer company with no monthly fee. I have been very happy with the results/ data collected. I lost my ring while traveling so I ordered another of the 2nd generation. Again I am happy with the results. I originally bought it for the sleep data and have been really satisfied with that. When I made a mistake in ordering my ring without the care package they were very accommodating in cancelling my order and then reordering with the care package. I like the longevity of the battery and the notice to charge gives you enough time to do that. Charging the ring is super fast

Title: Not Disability (immobility) friendly ….yet????
Content:
Your ring does not in any way cater for Disabled or Chronically ill people. Which is surprising, when it is said to be medically approved. I’d have thought it would be designed with those people in mind. Alas, I am bed and wheelchair bound, but get asked to get up out of my sedentary position constantly all day long. I find it extremely offensive and frustrating that I can’t turn this off, despite not having the exercise options on. It thinks I’m taking steps when it’s been over a dozen years when I took any. Please, please update this! Even the Apple Watch has a wheelchair user option to recognise if a person does not have the ability to be mobile.

As for the other features. They are great. But.. an alert on your phone/app for extremely abnormal O2 sats or HR would be much more useful than having to look it up after the fact.

Title: Love the fit

I do weightlifting, volleyball, yoga, boxing…etc. It’s totally my fault for not doing more research. I really like everything else about it. If it tracked more exercises then it would be a 5 star. The cycle tracking and the sleep tracking I like. It might over count my steps though. My Apple Watch always has a couple thousand less steps than the ring. So I don’t really trust that and I go above and beyond my step goal

Title: Theres nothing "smart" about it.
Content:
Review for Ringconn Gen 2

Overall, really disappointed in this product.
I honestly want to return it. But one, it will cost me to ship it back. and two, I dont have time to deal with that right now.

Its basically a wearable ring health tracker. theres nothing "smart" about it.
It only writes data, it doesnt read. meaning that it can only go off its own data.
I wish i did more research and got something with more integration, AI, habits, and insights.
the main reason i chose this ring was for the sleep apnea and O2 tracking, which im not even happy with.

only positive i have is the battery life.

Negatives:
* you can tell from its language that it was manufactured in china.
* iv had issues with the O2 not reading correctly, which is the primary reason i got it.
* I also got it specifically for the sleep apnea tracking, but what i didnt find out till i got it, is that you have to turn on that setting for it to work, its not tracking everyday on its own. also it says that it consumes more battery life as well.
* I get warnings for "outliers" in my heart rate and HRV all the time, but its mostly because my schedule varies so much.
* also considers my panic attacks as "moderate to high - intensity activity / exercise mode" even when heart rate is unusually high and theres little to no movement.
* i also hate how they have ads on facebook that you can wear it while swimming and in the sauna, but when you read about the ring in the app, it specifically says you shouldnt wear it in the sauna.

Those are all the issues i can think of off hand, but im sure theres more.
Overall, my suggestion is do your research. theres better options than this.
CleanText: review for ringconn gen overall really disappointed in this product i honestly want to return it but one it will cost me to ship it back and two i dont have time to deal with that right now its basically a wearable ring health tracker theres nothing smart about it it only writes data it doesnt read meaning that it can only go off its own data i wish i did more research and got something with more integration ai habits and insights the main reason i chose this ring was for the sleep apnea and o tracking which im not even happy with only positive i have is the battery life negatives you can tell from its language that it was manufactured in china iv had issues with the o not reading correctly which is the primary reason i got it i also got it specifically for the sleep apnea tracking but what i didnt find out till i got it is that you have to turn on that setting for it to work its not tracking everyday on its own also it says that it consumes more battery life as well i get warnings for outliers in my heart rate and hrv all the time but its mostly because my schedule varies so much also considers my panic attacks as moderate to high intensity activity exercise mode even when heart rate is unusually high and theres little to no movement i also hate how they have ads on facebook that you can wear it while swimming and in the sauna but when you read about the ring in the app it specifically says you shouldnt wear it in the sauna those are all the issues i can think of off hand but im sure theres more overall my suggestion is do your research theres better options than this

Title: Super pleased with my ringconn ring…
Content:
Super pleased with my ringconn ring (gen 2). It’s super light, and looks great! I forget it’s even on my finger most days. It has replaced my wedding band.

As far as tracking goes, it does an awesome job. I’m sure other more pricier options out there like the Oura do a better job tracking but I refused to pay for a monthly subscription and they are also more expensive & bulkier. In all reality none of these rings are 100% accurate but they give you a baseline.

As far as the battery goes, the ringconn last me anywhere from 10-11 days and I love that!! Very pleased with my purchase and definitely recommend it.

Title: Great alternative to smart-watch for biometrics.
Content:
Ringconn
Good product.

The app covers all the biometrics comprehensively. Information is displayed well and has both (i)explanations and (>) break-out boxes with more detail.
Previous daily data is a matter of swiping right (and left to come back). Judging from the calendar drop down this will probably include daily data for as long as you keep it.
Longer term trends are also available from a different tab.

The ring is easy to wear, remarkably lightweight, and looks good. The ring's durability has yet to be fully tested but has survived a fair amount of basic tool use and gardening so far. I don't avoid getting it wet with the exception that I avoid putting it in hot water (dishes, showers etc).

There's always minor issues that may be in development or just personal preferences, nothing at all show stopping though.
(Audience for the following is more for the developers.)
Y-Axis of graphs varies across days making visual comparisons inconclusive.
.. there could be user defined ranges.
.. or ranges could be re-aligned automatically when required.
.. these could be toggled on/off.
X-Axis includes multiple data points per column.
.. a single column contains low,medium,high,vigorous.
.. this could be a minute by minute line showing the fluctuations.
.. again this could be toggled on/off.
Sleep value went down after unusually large amounts of sleep.
.. makes sense, something is wrong... but;
.. app says "slow down", so is only looking at final score, not gross value of sleep.
(Also records 'sleep' while I'm screen-reading books)
The Stress indicator appears remarkably inaccurate. I don't know enough to make suggestions but it is an area that would likely benefit from some more research.
Data doesn't update without an internet connection.
.. surely the base calculations are simple enough to process on device. There are times when it quite difficult to obtain internet on a regular basis.
Some of those points would be concessions to battery life, and battery life was a primary consideration of purchase.
CleanText: ringconn good product the app covers all the biometrics comprehensively information is displayed well and has both iexplanations and breakout boxes with more detail previous daily data is a matter of swiping right and left to come back judging from the calendar drop down this will probably include daily data for as long as you keep it longer term trends are also available from a different tab the ring is easy to wear remarkably lightweight and looks good the rings durability has yet to be fully tested but has survived a fair amount of basic tool use and gardening so far i dont avoid getting it wet with the exception that i avoid putting it in hot water dishes showers etc theres always minor issues that may be in development or just personal preferences nothing at all show stopping though audience for the following is more for the developers yaxis of graphs varies across days making visual comparisons inconclusive there could be user defined ranges or ranges could be realigned automatically when required these could be toggled onoff xaxis includes multiple data points per column a single column contains lowmediumhighvigorous this could be a minute by minute line showing the fluctuations again this could be toggled onoff sleep value went down after unusually large amounts of sleep makes sense something is wrong but app says slow down so is only looking at final score not gross value of sleep also records sleep while im screenreading books the stress indicator appears remarkably inaccurate i dont know enough to make suggestions but it is an area that would likely benefit from some more research data doesnt update without an internet connection surely the base calculations are simple enough to process on device there are times when it quite difficult to obtain internet on a regular basis some of those points would be concessions to battery life and battery life was a primary consideration of purchase

Title: This Ringconn Gen Air ring is what I…
Content: This Ringconn Gen Air ring is what I needed. It tracks my heart health during the day and night, which is very important to me. I have a medical condition, Atrial Fibrillation, which I want to monitor all the heart functions. The ringconn ring allows Sp02, HRV, and Respiratory Rate. The Ringconn ring is comfortable to wear and light enough on my finger. I'm given a detailed report every day of my heart functions on my phone. All the information will provide me with what I am concerned with, so I can call my cardiologist and inform them of readings I need an explanation for. I'm aware the Ringconn ring is not FDA approved; they are working on this feverishly, but so far it's right on the money for me.

Title: I am on about week 3 of using the ring…
Content: I am on about week 3 of using the ring and am loving it. It is easy to use and I'm amazed at the amount of information that it is able to track. So far my only suggestion is that it would be helpful if there were a marking on the outside of the ring, either top or bottom, to show when the two inside "pins" are properly positioned. In dim or dark situations it is often difficult for me to tell if the ring is properly positioned. The main reason I got the ring was to monitor my SpO2 which, for unknown reasons, had been dropping precipitously during the day and I needed to be able to track it in real time. I find the ring to be more accurate than the finger oximeter.

Title: RingConn 2 Air
Content: I own both RingConn 2 models. My wife liked and kept my first purchase (which was for my pinky finger) so now I have purchased an Air for myself. I can't see any difference in weight or size between the two models. The specs indicate the Air has slightly shorter battery life and is made of Stainless Steel. The included charger is smaller but it doesn't include a battery like the standard model. I guess that's how they reduced the price. Personally I like the smaller charger and I don't mind charging it once a week. I do wish the gold color choice was available for the Air model. Now to the App... it doesn't have all the health metrics that the Apple watch has, but for what it does measure, the ring and watch are in close agreement. The RingConn app is easier to read at a glance and also easier to navigate. Drilling down, the detail is sensibly displayed using easy to understand graphs and charts. Finally, there is no monthly fee. Overall I think this is a great product. It does what it does exceptionally well and at a value price.

Title: RingConn Gen 2 Review from 🇩🇪
Content:
RingConn Gen 2 Review – A Sleek Alternative to the Smartwatch

I’ve been using the RingConn Gen 2 for about three weeks now, and I have to say—I’m genuinely impressed.

Customer Support That Delivers
My experience started on a positive note even before the ring arrived. I accidentally ordered the wrong size, but after contacting customer support, they quickly and efficiently arranged for the correct size to be shipped instead. The entire process was smooth, and I received the perfectly fitting ring without any issues.

A Small Device with Big Capabilities
What really surprised me was how advanced this little ring is when it comes to tracking health data. It captures a wide range of metrics throughout the day with impressive accuracy. As someone who has used smartwatches in the past, I’d say the RingConn is a compelling alternative—especially for those looking for something more discreet and lightweight.

Whether you're monitoring workouts, sleep, or vital signs, the ring delivers solid insights. That said, during strength training or any activity involving weights, I’d recommend using finger tape to avoid potential scratches.

Comfort & Fit
I’m not someone who normally wears rings, but I quickly got used to this one. It feels natural on the finger and doesn’t shift or feel loose—even during runs or fast, sudden movements. I never once felt like it might fall off.

Final Thoughts & Sizing Tip
The RingConn Gen 2 combines style, comfort, and functionality in a surprisingly compact form. For anyone looking to track their health without the bulk of a smartwatch, this ring is absolutely worth considering.

My recommendation for sizing:
I suggest choosing a comfortable size for your index finger that also fits snugly on your middle finger and slightly looser on your ring finger. This gives you flexibility and ensures the ring stays comfortable throughout the day, no matter which finger you wear it on.

Title: The return process unfortunately falls short.
Content: The return process unfortunately does not work well for the customer. I had to change ring sizes due to the ring being to loose. I used the sizing kit to choose the correct ring but the actual ring size fit to loosely. I had to ship the old ring back before they would ship the replacement which I had to pay for shipping. Ringconn provided a shipping label which ended up being ground shipping. This meant the ring would not get back to ringconn for 3 to 5 days. Meaning the new ring would not be shipped until received. I will be without the ring for almost two weeks. I consider this poor customer service. As a note sleep data is vastly over stated. The REM and DEEP stats are between three and four hours a night combined. My apple watch and Garmin are both under 2 hours. Based on the return experience and data issues I don't recommend this Ring. One positive note the battery life is amazing.

Title: LOVE the RingConn!!!
Content: I love the RingConn! I got my husband and myself the RingConn Gen 2 because of the longer battery life and the sleep apnea monitoring - the measurements it gets is accurate and the fact that you don't have to pay for a subscription is amazing and the primary reason we didn't get an Oura ring. The RingConns are super light feeling and it's nice that you can sync it to Apple Health and the Android Health, too. The only comments I have are that I wish the app has an option to put in health issues that affect your vitals and that the sizing rings versus the RingConn feel slightly different (the RingConn feels a couple of millimeters larger than the practice one, so we just bought spacers to help the sizing which worked) but it's overall great! Would highly recommend - in fact, I've been telling so many of my coworkers and friends about it, haha :)

Title: No ring, no refund, no real answers – feels like a scamI genuinely wish I had read more…
Content:
I genuinely wish I had read more reviews before placing my order. I’ve had one of the worst customer service experiences ever, and at this point, I feel completely scammed.

I placed an order in February and never received the ring. When I reached out to customer service, I was met with cold, robotic replies that all start and end exactly the same. Every time I asked a question, even if it was a follow-up on the same issue, they just copied and pasted the same paragraph. It’s like talking to a bot, not a real person. There’s zero effort to actually help or resolve anything.

After going back and forth for weeks, I still have NO ring, NO refund, and NO clear explanation of what’s going on. It honestly feels like they’re just stalling, hoping I’ll give up. Their process is incredibly frustrating and makes you feel powerless.

I wouldn’t recommend this company to anyone. The lack of transparency, accountability, and basic human support is shocking. Avoid at all costs.

Title: Data Accuracy
Content: The data provided by the ring in many cases is totally inaccurate. In particular the sleep analysis can be way off. For instance , it records me in deep sleep sometimes while sitting reading or on my phone prior to bed. Therefore, lying still in bed prior to falling asleep can be recorded totally wrong. Total sleep time and stages are generally not useful. Some other data like heartbeat may be much better.

Title: Great ring!
Content:
Great ring to monitor sleep, heart rate, stress level and basic daily activities. The battery lasts forever as advertised which was a seller for me. I did a VO2max test at my doctor wearing the ring and the heart rate monitoring was very accurate on the treadmill setting.
It is very light, slim and comfortable. I have the silver one which looks great with my gold wedding ring and mechanical watch.

My wishes:
Add more sports OR A FEATURE to monitor and record your heart rate in real time (to be displayed on a graph after) while you're doing a demanding cardio activity other than the 4 on the app.
Add swimming and a general indoor cardio workout for stationary machines.
VO2max reading?

Title: Great product!
Content: Date of experience: March 04, 2025
CleanText: date of experience march

Title: More good than bad
Content:
PROS: (1). Lightweight, attractive, well-built, comfortable to wear (2). User-friendly interface with easily understood and accessible data. GUI not “gimmicky” (3). Sleep apnea evaluation option (4). Fast response from customer service to questions (5). Outstanding battery life with fast recharge.
CONS: (1). Simply not dependable as a step-counting activity tracker. For instance, mowing on a riding lawn tractor for a few hours results in 17,000 steps counted. Per customer service: “certain devices may misinterpret some arm movements as walking, leading to an overestimation. Also, the ring estimates step count based on accelerometer data and other sensor inputs. Therefore, in daily life, certain movements—such as unconscious actions caused by ankle pain or hand movements while sitting—may sometimes be misinterpreted as steps, leading to an overestimation of step count.” So, 17,000 steps counted while seated. No sh*t, Sherlock! (2). Less than useful advice, like “The REM state still has room for improvement” without further recommendations.
OVERALL, while the device provides a wealth of data, much of that data and evaluation seems integrated into questionable accelerometer data, so the balance of the data feels less reliable than I had expected. However, I believe this is a common problem with ring-type trackers, and not unique to RingConn.
CleanText: pros lightweight attractive wellbuilt comfortable to wear userfriendly interface with easily understood and accessible data gui not gimmicky sleep apnea evaluation option fast response from customer service to questions outstanding battery life with fast recharge cons simply not dependable as a stepcounting activity tracker for instance mowing on a riding lawn tractor for a few hours results in steps counted per customer service certain devices may misinterpret some arm movements as walking leading to an overestimation also the ring estimates step count based on accelerometer data and other sensor inputs therefore in daily life certain movementssuch as unconscious actions caused by ankle pain or hand movements while sittingmay sometimes be misinterpreted as steps leading to an overestimation of step count so steps counted while seated no sht sherlock less than useful advice like the rem state still has room for improvement without further recommendations overall while the device provides a wealth of data much of that data and evaluation seems integrated into questionable accelerometer data so the balance of the data feels less reliable than i had expected however i believe this is a common problem with ringtype trackers and not unique to ringconn

Title: Loyal Gen1 User - Soon to be Signing Off.
Content:
Ringconn Gen1 user here.

I've been using my Gen1 ring now religiously for around 14months, and the battery has started to last only a few hours - not the 1 week or so that it did when it was new.

I've had a cracking experience with this ring, but its days are now numbered - sadly.

Now, I did message Ringconn on a social media channel, which never got a reply and is basically rubbish service (especially these days - not even an acknowledgement).

To this end, I won't be upgrading to a Gen2 and I'll be going elsewhere for my next wearable ring tech.

Content: I placed my order on Feb 16th and I’m still waiting for it, 3 weeks later. The carriers they pick to deliver within EU are terrible! Title: Ringe size change RingConn Gen 2.
Content: I had to change my RingConn Gen 2 Mate Black size 13 to size 12 and had a good customer experience with the RingConn support Team in changing the ring size against a little fee. I think the difference to the the size kit is also quite strong related to the swelling in cold and warm weather also the swelling in the night. For example with ring size 12, i can use it in the night an the left indexfinger and in daytime on the right index finger, while with size 13 i can wear in the night at the right index finger, but in daytime i'm losing it from both index fingers. Regarding functionality i'm quite happy, regarding walking steps it seems to overestimate in comparison to my Garmin Fenix 7 watch. I' very happy with sleep recording and sleep apnoe screening. The app is fine, but the apps from other smart rings are a little nicer regarding design and overview charts.

Title: So far I can give the RingConn…
Content: So far I can give the RingConn team five stars but it’s hard to rate the actual product that high. I got my first ring in late November 2024 and something happened to the battery within a few months. I got my second ring in February as a replacement. The support team was great with the whole process. The ring does what it is supposed to. The thinner side walls make for a very comfortable wear. Hopefully this one will last longer than my first one did.

Title: I am quite pleased with my RingConn Gen 3
Content:
I ordered my RingConn 2 during the Kickstarter campaign. I am a patient person and found no problems with that process, they kept me informed and delivered when promised.

I have been enjoying my ring very much, I’m not concerned with super accuracy, but use it to measure my sleep, stress, activity trends. When I reached out to them about a problem, they responded promptly and the ring was ultimately replaced.

There is always room for improvement but I recommend the ring and the company.

Title: Sleep monitor - check!
Content:
I bought ringconn specifically for sleep patterns. This ring has exceeded my expectations. I've been wearing it non-stop for almost 2 months. It's so thin and easy I forget it's on my finger. Definitely opt to get the sizing kit as it fits differently.
ns FINALLY my big love is battery life. I get at least 10 days but often more than advertised...I get 14-16 days on a single charge. That blasts all other smart rings away.
And all this data keeps syncing without a monthly fee! That was a showstopper for me. Get this smart ring. It's awesome!

Title: Buying and using the RingConn2
Content:
Key points: Pros- great service, smooth buying experience and love the product. Sleep tracking is excellent. (For women- cycle tracking aspect is intuitive and un-intrusive)
Cons- only registers running and cycling as exercises, no manual entry for other forms of exercise or times when you can't wear it.

I backed the RingConn2 in its Kickstarter campaign. The whole process was smooth and hassle free. I got my sizing kit fairly quickly, and wore a few different sizes to see what felt right. I found it very difficult to select the right size, but eventually settled on one. When the time came, I selected my colour and size, and sat back and waited for my order to be shipped. Once I got it, I discovered that the fit was not as I expected, but enough larger than the demo sizer to not fit me properly, so I requested a size exchange. This went through without a hitch, and I absolutely LOVE my RingConn2 ring! It tracks my sleep very well (which is the main reason I got it) and all my other bios. The one and only nit that I would pick would be that you can't enter manual exercise entries, and the ring only records running & cycling. This means that the fitness classes that I do where I can't wear the ring don't get recognised as active/activity times. Also, it doesn't register any of the fitness classes I do as exercise, and if it's a low/no impact class that doesn't register any steps but does raise the heartrate, the app registers my exercise as moderate stress.
This is not enough of an issue to impact my satisfaction with the ring and the process of buying it online.
The cycle tracking is fairly basic but pretty easy to use and easy enough to modify if needed. The interface is intuitive and un-intrusive.
CleanText: key points pros great service smooth buying experience and love the product sleep tracking is excellent for women cycle tracking aspect is intuitive and unintrusive cons only registers running and cycling as exercises no manual entry for other forms of exercise or times when you cant wear it i backed the ringconn in its kickstarter campaign the whole process was smooth and hassle free i got my sizing kit fairly quickly and wore a few different sizes to see what felt right i found it very difficult to select the right size but eventually settled on one when the time came i selected my colour and size and sat back and waited for my order to be shipped once i got it i discovered that the fit was not as i expected but enough larger than the demo sizer to not fit me properly so i requested a size exchange this went through without a hitch and i absolutely love my ringconn ring it tracks my sleep very well which is the main reason i got it and all my other bios the one and only nit that i would pick would be that you cant enter manual exercise entries and the ring only records running cycling this means that the fitness classes that i do where i cant wear the ring dont get recognised as activeactivity times also it doesnt register any of the fitness classes i do as exercise and if its a lowno impact class that doesnt register any steps but does raise the heartrate the app registers my exercise as moderate stress this is not enough of an issue to impact my satisfaction with the ring and the process of buying it online the cycle tracking is fairly basic but pretty easy to use and easy enough to modify if needed the interface is intuitive and unintrusive

Title: Really enjoy the tool to track my day
Content: So far my gen2 ring has been a great product. Unfortunately my last ring failed after 30 days, I believe it may of been one of the updates. But I don’t know for sure. The support team worked with me and got me a replacement, it did take a while but it was a new release ring at the time. It tracked everything very accurately. I have compared the 02 readings to my pulsox finger reader and the 02 and puls are always within 1-2 points. The ring is light and there are plenty of cover options. The sleep monitor is pretty accurate. Might be off by 15-30 min for sleep time sometimes. I am excited for them to add more exercise to track. Great app, easy to get my information.

Title: Great Product & Outstanding Customer Service!
Content:
I discovered the RingConn 2 through Kickstarter and purchased it as a Super Early Bird. Right from the start, the ring met my expectations, and with each update, the app improved even further.

Unfortunately, over New Year’s, I experienced a significant decline in battery performance. Since battery wear and tear is excluded from the warranty, I reached out to customer service. Their support was excellent – they provided multiple solutions, and I even kept a log to help diagnose the issue.

What can I say? My ring was replaced without any hassle! The customer service was always courteous and helpful. I can wholeheartedly recommend both the product and the support team.

Title: Love love my v.2 Ring conn
Content: Love love my v.2 Ring conn. From the get go seeing all the impressive data is incredibly addictive and informative Upgraded because I really liked v.1 but the allure of a slimmer profile, longer battery life and apnea tracking all with out a subscriber fee. Sign me up! Was very disappointed to find that after a couple months the battery life was significantly declining to the point it needed charging each day. I mentioned to customer support and after trying a few things to troubleshoot they quickly offered a replacement ring. Arrived quickly and with not drama I also love that they listen to their customers as well when a new update included a dark background (resulting in even longer battery life) I was very upset as it made it very difficult for me to read. Many others felt the same. They now offer the option of both settings. So. Love their responsiveness. And great product! Highly recommend

Title: Simple, Efficient, Long Lasting Smart Ring in the Market!
Content: Why RingConn? I've tried other smart fit tracker device and smart watches are not for me. I'm personally looking for a smart ring device that is simple, efficient and has long lasting battery. Comparing it with other brands in the market, their technology and "free app" integration were the wins for me. Not to mention, its affordable price range. I wanted to use it mainly to keeping track of my heart rates and primarily my sleep. I got the RingConn 2 Silver from their Black Friday sale on their website as an early Christmas gift for myself! It was definitely worth the purchase! Shipping was fast to the Philippines. Make sure first to get their sizing kit to ensure you'll get the perfect and comfortable fit. I've been using it for the past three months and it's pretty much seamless- sometimes I forgot that I'm wearing it. One downside though is the silicone ring protection. It's thin enough for comfort however not that durable as it got essily worn out. Nonetheless, this dmart ring device serves its purpose to let me know how I'm sleeping and a motivation to drive a fit lifestyle. Thank you RingConn Team! More power and I hope the app stays free 🙏

Title: This ring gives you a wealth of information about you!
Content:
I've really been impressed with this ring, it's been helpful in confirming my sleep apnea and helping me make changes so that I can be healthier. I would like to see more information in the future, like circadian rhythm monitors,

But most of all, I'd like to see tracking for people with chronic illness. We have different needs than always healthy people, but we are also in need of health tracking like this. Something that adjusts to our needs would be really awesome. I can see the hints of such things already in the app, I hope to see more in the future.

Title: Best SmartRing
Content: I’ve had this ring for two or three months now, and I’ve been wearing it almost every day, and I love it! I found the sizing to be pretty accurate to the kit that they offer. With the gold finish, beware that the palm side of the ring will scratch if you’re using it to work out with dumbbells, etc. However, this is expected and the most visible parts of the ring hold up very well to every day wear and tear. I love the app and how easily accessible everything is, and the battery life of the ring is exceptional! It really does last around 10 days on a full charge. I bought this ring because I didn’t like the sporty look of most smart watches, as I typically have to wear business professional clothing. Both me and my friend whom I recommended the ring to love this wearable technology! And let’s not forget that you don’t have to pay to use the RingConn app😉

Title: So apart from the long shipping time…
Content:
So apart from the long shipping time due to it coming from china, the ringconn has been amazing. For starters this ring has an amazing battery life. At no point has it ever run low. I bought this to track my sleep so I can charge my watch and still get accurate sleep data. Overall it has very similar data as my apple watch 10 collects but with the added bonus of a 2 week battery life.

As for the sleep apnea tracking I have used it once or twice and it seems to be pretty accurate, again in line with my watch data.

Content: Very happy with sleep tracking and battery life. Activity tracking needs improvement. It is not accurate and needs to support additional activities. Heart Rate is not accurate when running. Title: The product is ok
Content: The product is good. The application is good with a lot of data. I don’t like that there are only 3 options to choose to track exercise. I do multiple forms of exercise and can only track running and biking. That’s stupid. I wrote RingConn and they sent an absurd reply regarding an “algorithm” that makes it difficult to track. I especially do not like the fact that the terms and conditions/privacy agreement basically states that all data obtained from the device is property of the People’s Republic of China (PRC). This feels like a violation of my privacy to know my health data is now the property of another government.

Title: When I exercise
Content:
When I exercise, it count as stress! When I excersice, it doesn't usually count as activity. There is no options for Yoga, meditatition etc.

The ring doesn't automatically sync with the APP, it should be and send me notifications in the APP in case of sedentary and other parameters.

Title: There’s room for improvement.
Content:
I like the ring sizing kit. It was more than what expected. I wear the actual ring every day. It is solid and comfortable. Also waterproof. I don’t have to take it off to shower. The only improvement that it needs is better accuracy of the oxygen monitoring. I wear a pulse oximeter (Wellue) that is very accurate. The ring, in comparison, reads 3-5 points higher consistently. If that could be improved, I would trust it more to wear alone and not have to use the extra device.
Hopefully the battery will hold its 7 day charge for a long time, which is another great feature.

Title: Lacks major connected app support. MFP, google health, etc...
Content:
This ring does no tnconnect well to 3rd pty apps

There is no google health support, which replaced fit, and is literally 1/2 of the market share for android phones in the US, probably the world.

Step syncing to fit is not 1:1 counts are horribly off, and remain that way, its not a syncing lag, its literally the wrong data.

The ring itself is awesome with a great app and amazing insights, but most of us are going to use My fitness pal, or some other health app, and neither are compatible with this device either

There are some easy wins here if Rongconn fixes this, but if your expecting this ring to fit your ecosystem you will be disappointed in the lack of connected app support.

Title: The RingConn Gen 2 (RCG2) is an…
Content: The RingConn Gen 2 (RCG2) is an excellent health ring that helps me meet my health goals. It tracks my steps, heart rate, and blood oxygen level. I shopped around, and chose RCG2 because it does what the others do, but also has sleep apnea detection. It is thin and light, and has longer battery life than the competition. It also has no subscription fee to use the app. A bonus is that the app shares data with Google Fit app, and I use both. My only complaint is once I confirmed the size, and changed my mind on color, the online order page never showed a change in choices or order status, then it took two weeks to arrive. However, customer service was quick to respond, and reassuring. It is beautiful, and comfortable. I'm very happy with it, and would recommend to others.

Title: Sort of good
Content:
I bought the ring with the hope of replacing a monitoring band for sleep and stress tracking.
The experience has been ok...ish. It tracks your pulse and blood oxigen quite accurately. Also stress during the day is pretty accurate.
When it comes to sleep tracking, that's where things take a turn for the worse. While it is quite good in identifying when you go to sleep (it makes the difference between sleeping and just lying on the couch watching a movie), the actual sleep parameters, I find are quite off. You generally wake up to a sleep score of over 85 even on bad nights. HRV during the night, for me, was quite unchanged, whether I had a relaxation day or an intense workout day with lots of work besides it. It generally overshoots both REM and Deep Sleep, undershooting awake time.
Activity tracking is limited to walking, running and biking and only if location is turned on. This last part, for me, was enough reason to not use it as an activity tracker.
On the plus side, support is really fast on answering questions and addressing problems, however, I do not know how much of the feedback they use for improvement.
There is lots of potential in this ring, but some of the aspects really need atention.
CleanText: i bought the ring with the hope of replacing a monitoring band for sleep and stress tracking the experience has been okish it tracks your pulse and blood oxigen quite accurately also stress during the day is pretty accurate when it comes to sleep tracking thats where things take a turn for the worse while it is quite good in identifying when you go to sleep it makes the difference between sleeping and just lying on the couch watching a movie the actual sleep parameters i find are quite off you generally wake up to a sleep score of over even on bad nights hrv during the night for me was quite unchanged whether i had a relaxation day or an intense workout day with lots of work besides it it generally overshoots both rem and deep sleep undershooting awake time activity tracking is limited to walking running and biking and only if location is turned on this last part for me was enough reason to not use it as an activity tracker on the plus side support is really fast on answering questions and addressing problems however i do not know how much of the feedback they use for improvement there is lots of potential in this ring but some of the aspects really need atention

Title: Great Company & Product
Content: I secured my first ring through the Ringconn2 kickstarter program. Loved the ring but unfortunately. I lost it after a couple of months. During the campaign and right through the loss of my ring, RingConn customer service was readily available and most helpful. They returned communication quickly, listened to my concerns and suggestions. and were professional. I did order a replacement ring with a discount and was very happy with the process. About 2 weeks after it was received, the company updated the ring/software with a "find me" feature. A little late to find my ring, but they listened and recognized a need and improved for their customers. WELL DONE!! Awaiting the update for blood sugar and blood pressure!

Title: Ok, but could be better
Content: Connectivity glitches sometimes leaving data gaps. I had some issues with ending walking exercise. I snowboard and indoor bike. There is no way to log this and heart shows as outliers when I do these activities. Sleep logging is frequently off recording reading time in bed as sleep or light sleep when my brain is churning. My REM sleep seems low no matter what I do so I have to wonder how accurate this thing really is. I recently had the flu and the device logged abnormal temperatures which would be explained by the flu rather than the suggestion that I may have a metabolic disorder. It seems like it would be simple to include an over health status log as well as regular weight tracking. You have a lot of potential in this device, but it could be so much better and useful.

Title: I really enjoy the RingConn 2
Content: I really enjoy the RingConn 2, but after comparing it to the Oura Ring 4 for over a month now, the difference in sleep detection is WAY off. Most often it will be off by 1-2 hours. I do notice the heart rate is very close to the Oura Ring 4 and Apple Watch, it is almost spot on with my pulse ox. Just my biggest complaint is the sleep detection, once I adjust the time manually the REM and Deep Sleep are about 90% of the time very similar to the Oura Ring 4. The one benefit of the RingConn 2 though is the no subscription, it is a one time buy and that’s it. For that, I have to change my original rating of 3 stars to 4 stars.

Title: Super disappointed
Content: I loved the ring at first, loved the data and keeping track of my health. But after six months the battery will no longer hold a charge and it is basically useless. I contacted ringconn and they insist that I do a bunch of troubleshooting and track data for two weeks to prove that it’s not working. They refuse to replace it until I’ve done this, and I have my doubts that they will replace it even then. I guess that’s the risk you take when you try a new product that hasn’t been around long enough to really test. I’m so disappointed by the quality and lack of customer service.

Title: RingConn is fantastic
Content: This ring tracks vital statistics and helps me understand what is going on with my health. It also motivates me to be more active and to pay attention to my sleep. It provides an at a glance view of how you are doing and it also has a more in depth view of each area. It shows what is considered normal so you can see if there are any potential problems. I highly recommend this for everyone.

Title: I love it!
Content: I love the ring! It's super lightweight so you barely notice you're wearing it, and the data is phenomenal! I was tired of having an extension of my phone on my wrist so I switched to an analog watch but still wanted to track my health stats, so this is the perfect solution! My only complaint is that I had no idea it was coming from Hong Kong (maybe that's my fault for not reading more details) so it took a whole month to get to me (I'm in Canada) since I didn't already know my size. If I had known my size, I think it would have taken half that time. But it was worth the wait!

Title: Great Ring, unique sizing, not so good shipping
Content: The ring is fantastic with amazing tracking abilities. I love that it tracks pretty much everything my smart watch does, but in a small package that doesn’t stand out. The fit is a little disappointing, because of sensors and shape I had to get a 14, I’m a 12-12.5 normally, since there are no half sizes I find myself switching fingers throughout the day as my fingers change. The one BIG let down from me was shipping. The site said 5-7 days for the sizer, but nothing on the ring itself. I paid for expedited shipping and it took 2 weeks to get!!! How long is normal shipping? If you can’t expedite at least refund the extra shipping fee, or notify the customer. It took a week from the package tag being created to even leave Hong Kong!

Content:
This is the second ring I’ve bought. The first was for my wife who is extremely pleased with it. This second one is for me. Truth be told, l had a lot of problems receiving it. Indeed somewhere along the shipment line it must have got lost. However the customer service was absolutely top notch and after having made the necessary verifications a new one was sent out. Very kind and friendly service.
As for the ring itself, the info is very useful and interesting to have and actually makes a difference to some habits one might have.
Very good!

Title: Game-Changer for Smart Wearables! ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐
Content:
I’ve been using the Ringcom Smart Ring for a few weeks now, and I’m beyond impressed! The design is sleek, lightweight, and incredibly comfortable—I often forget I’m even wearing it. The health tracking features are spot on, providing accurate insights into my heart rate, sleep patterns, and activity levels.

What really sets this ring apart is its seamless integration with my devices. The battery life is outstanding, lasting several days on a single charge, and the app interface is intuitive and easy to navigate.

If you’re looking for a stylish and functional alternative to bulky smartwatches, the Ringcom Smart Ring is a must-have. Highly recommend!

Title: My ring simply doesn't accurately track…
Content:
Based on my experiences over the past two weeks of continuous use—both during the day and at night—I have some concerns about the RingConn's activity tracking accuracy. Specifically, I've noticed that the sleep tracking data appears to be significantly off. For example, on the first two nights, despite getting nearly 7 hours of sleep, the app recorded only about half that duration. I initially expected that ongoing use might help refine the sleep tracking algorithm, but so far, the nightly data has not improved.

For additional context, I primarily wear the ring on my left index finger, and occasionally on my middle finger, where it fits perfectly. As a comparison, I monitored my sleep with an Apple Watch, which consistently recorded around 7 hours of sleep each night. This contrast between the two devices leads me to question the overall reliability of the RingConn in tracking sleep and daily activity accurately.

Title: Pro and cons
Content:
The sleep tracking is quite accurate and stable compared with many other trackers. The heart rate monitor too.
The app is just right, simple and not overwhelming.
It doesn't feel bulky wearing it.
The step tracking is actually very bad, sometimes I get up in the morning, I get to the kitchen and I have 300 steps counted.
The exercises are very very limited, there is nothing about anaerobic exercises such as bodyweight.
I hate the fact that I need the charger to exit airplane mode, in 2025 it shouldn't be. I can't wear it while welding ( which is a big part of my job) and my phone drains the battery looking for the ring, if I put it in airplane mode I need to bring the charger with me, but most of smart ring wearers do it because of the very small size of it and if I need to bring the charger at work it loses part of the porpoise.
Overall a great product.

Title: My ring finally arrived and the…
Content: My ring finally arrived and the packaging was impressive! It’s early days but so far I am very pleased with the overall functionality and supporting application. Key to greater usefulness going forward will be the addition of a much wider range of activities for tracking. Ideally, the ring could sense activity levels and start tracking on its own? Hopefully the company doesn’t make the mistake of its predecessors and start to try and figure out how to get more money out of us with subscriptions unless there is significant value add.

Content: The ring fascinated me. I think the ring is better than a smartwatch, especially because of its versatility and the fact that it looks more like a piece of jewelry than a biometric device. Title: Best smart ring
Content:
Amazing Innovation – The RingCon Smart Ring is a Game-Changer!

I recently purchased the RingCon Smart Ring, and it has completely exceeded my expectations. This innovative device seamlessly blends style, functionality, and advanced technology into a sleek, wearable gadget that has quickly become an essential part of my daily life.

Compact Yet Powerful

Despite its small size, the RingCon Smart Ring offers a wide array of features. From fitness tracking to health monitoring, it delivers accurate and reliable data, all at the tip of your finger—literally! It’s hard to believe how much technology is packed into such a lightweight and comfortable accessory.

Health and Fitness Tracking

The fitness tracking capabilities are outstanding. It tracks heart rate, steps, calories burned, and even sleep patterns with impressive accuracy. I love waking up and checking the detailed breakdown of my sleep cycle, which has helped me make significant improvements to my routine.

Seamless Connectivity

Pairing the ring with my smartphone was quick and effortless. The app is intuitive, with a clean interface that makes it easy to access insights and reports. Notifications and alerts from my phone are subtle yet effective, ensuring I stay connected without the constant distraction of checking my device.

Stylish Design

The RingCon Smart Ring is as stylish as it is functional. Its sleek, minimalist design makes it perfect for everyday wear, whether I’m at the gym, at work, or out for the evening. It doesn’t feel bulky or intrusive, and I’ve received countless compliments on its modern aesthetic.

Battery Life That Impresses

One of the standout features is the impressive battery life. A single charge lasts several days, which is incredibly convenient. I never feel tied down by constant charging, which is a huge bonus for any wearable device.

Durability and Comfort

The ring is made with high-quality materials that are not only durable but also comfortable for all-day wear. I barely notice it on my finger, and it holds up well to daily activities, including workouts and washing my hands.

Why I Recommend It

The RingCon Smart Ring is the perfect combination of practicality, style, and cutting-edge technology. Whether you’re looking to improve your health, stay connected, or simply own an innovative piece of tech, this ring is a fantastic choice.

Final Thoughts

RingCon has truly outdone itself with this smart ring. It has quickly become a staple in my routine, and I can’t imagine going back to life without it. If you’re on the fence about purchasing one, I wholeheartedly recommend giving it a try. You won’t regret it!

Five stars for this incredible product!

Title: Buyer Beware
Content: Hello Everyone, I was one of the original backers of RingConn. For us Ringcon promised a 2 year warranty. My ring has stopped working correctly after a year and half and now needs to be charged daily. They have said/admited that this should not happen and it is a warranty issue. They have really handled my defective ping poorly. They offered only $110 towards a Gen2 ring which is a joke. When I said no they offered to send me a new gen 1 ring. Both options are not good but at least the gen 1 replacement is better. I accepted that option. Now they're saying they don't have it and not sure when they will and they just expect me to wait. I've also read they are not manufacturing any more Gen 1 rings so it seems they just hope this will go be forgotten and go away. This is crazy. I have asked them to escalate this issue but I can feel the pushback like afraid to escalate to a manager. Also, it's sometimes days at a time before I receive a response back from them. The rings are not cheap as we all know. They have handled this very poorly and in my mind unacceptable if they were a reputable company.

Title: Love this ring! - from a newbie smart ring owner
Content: Ring is extremely well-made, with comfortable slim fit, much less bulky than any other ring on the market. Fit is slightly different than sizing kit, but this is most likely due to the smooth, slick internal coating of the ring versus the plastic material of the sizer. Comfortable to wear all day and all night. I find that the app is well-made, and although the app update changed the look of the main metrics page, it is intuitive and appears pretty accurate, particularly from a sleep tracking perspective. And the sleep score is extremely helpful--even when I get adequate or at least better length of sleep, I can associate my quality of rest accurately with a good or bad sleep score. Nap auto-detection is particularly impressive. I only wish workout detection was automatic and there were more options for workout types.

Title: Maybe I expect too much for the price…
Content:
Maybe I expect too much for the price point the outer ring is very cheap and scratches easy. Should be a more durable material such as stainless steel or titanium.

The metrics are good and very accurate when compared with my Garmin watch. I would Iove to see more metrics if it's possible.
CleanText: maybe i expect too much for the price point the outer ring is very cheap and scratches easy should be a more durable material such as stainless steel or titanium the metrics are good and very accurate when compared with my garmin watch i would iove to see more metrics if its possible

Title: Great ring but software could be improved
Content:
I love my RingConn ring. As I also own the gen 3 Oura ring I feel that I can provide a meaningful perspective.

Pros: RingConn has a slimmer profile, longer battery life, and best of all, no monthly fee. In addition, I have a rare limitation in that the Oura ring doesn't accurately read my heart rate, while both gen 1 and gen 2 versions of the RingConn read my heart rate flawlessly.

Cons: Where RingConn falls short is that some of the software aspects are not quite as good as Oura. For example, Oura has much better accuracy at reading when I'm awake vs being asleep. Many times where the RingConn shows me sleeping, the Oura accurately recognized that I was awake and reading a book. Another area where RingConn falls short is that there is no integration with partner software, so it doesn't recognize workouts I might have done that are recorded on Strava and Apple Health.

The RingConn app is good with lots of useful information. I find that the AI aspect is not very useful and gets in the way of just looking at the data. In contrast, Oura has a slightly more meaningful UI that makes it easier to understand the data presented.

Overall I can recommend the RingConn. It's solid, reliable and the lack of a monthly membership fee is a welcome benefit.

Title: I have had the rings for sometime now…
Content:
I have had the rings for sometime now both gen 1 and 2. The timings and information provided are quite accurate and informative. I seem to be having connectivity issues with the G2 as it is disconnecting more often than the G1 would. The largest size ring 14 is a little tight for my hand but that's not a big deal,larger size would be great. Overall very pleased with performance and data collected.
Pros: light weight,aesthetics good,accurate readings,app easy,battery life good.
Cons: random disconnect, reset through charger,size for me personally need larger,has on occasions connected to random phone of friend( no data transfer to random phone though) mindful of scratching when using weight exercise( normal with any ring).
I would and have highly recommended this health tracker as accurate and worth the cost.

Title: I have had ringconn for more than two…
Content: I have had ringconn for more than two months. Ringconn is completely unable to cope with high-intensity physical activity. Title: My experience has been great
Content: My experience has been great. I was excited why I found out at the ringcon2 and preorders from kick starter. So how I did receive my email/code to preorder on their site. I reached out them think it would be to late and sorry we can't do anything type of response. To my surprise it was literally the opposite. They seemed genuinely sorry that I didn't get the emails/links. Even know it was still past the time they created a link/code that allowed me to still get the presale deal. But then they also followed up to make sure it worked for me and I was able to do. That is what I called amazing customer service. As for the ring it's self I'm in love with it. My wife has the Samsung ring and my sister has the Aura. I have better battery life and I like interface better also. Great product and amazing customer service. I will say to be transparent the one thing I do not like is the ring protector. I've tried two different sizes to see if I maybe grow to liking it. Nope sorry. It made the ring seem bulky and cheap. That's saying a lot saying this ring is smaller then the others. I have large hands and it's the perfect size. It's not so tiny thits dainty but not large. It's like the perfect size for for anyone. Sorry guys about ring protector just have to be honest. Otherwise customer for life and recommend the ring hands down. I got my then end of October and have worn it everyday but 1 day.

Title: Amazing ring
Content:
First, I'll start with the obvious. The battery life is amazing. You have to think so seldom about it while it collects the data. Second, the fit is wonderful. Much thinner than the test ring. I usually hate rings, but this one just found a permanent home. Have gotten so many compliments. I've only had it for a month, but haven't scratched or scuffed it yet. Connectivity always works (which is refreshing).

On the it's ok side is the app. Some elements are great others are annoying. I actually liked the app version I started with much more than the current version. They updates a week or so in and it was disappointing. The plan and AI elements are more in the way for me now. Most of this tech is new, so it's likely to improve.

Overall the hardware is exactly what I wanted. I'm so glad to go with ringconn over oura and I've ditched my Fitbit.

Title: I love my RingConn!
Content:
I love my RingConn!
Battery lasts forever, seems accurate enough, and is quite durable so far (I'm accident prone and always hit my hands against things - no issues for my RingConn so far (and I don't use the crappy plastic protector).
Only downside: the size of the ring is very noticeable at first. I wish it were slightly thinner.
I like the app however it's a little "clunky"; I don't feel like it flows as well as other apps and you can definitely tell that English is not the primary language of this app. It's good - just nitpicking as it could be better.
I love my RingConn though and do not regret my purchase.

Title: Hassle free monitoring of your health
Content:
I finally switched to RingConn from Oura. I had Oura for about a year before finally trying RingConn. Initially I'm very used to Oura's user friendly display but Oura comes with monthly subscription which I feel is a hassle. RingConn on the other hand is single purchase and you get daily monitoring as long as you have it on. When RingConn started monitoring Sleep Apnea I decided to give it a try. To my surprise RingConn also updated their software to be more user friendly.

So far I'm liking RingConn and I hope that it will continue to upgrade the software to be more userfriendly.

Title: My gen1 ring died on the same day the…
Content: My gen1 ring died on the same day the gen2 became available in an upgrade promotion. I don't believe in coincidences like that. Title: Couldn’t be happier!
Content: After a lot of research, I chose the Ringconn gen 2 and am so happy I did! Love, love, love that no subscription is required to get all the data. Steps don’t match my smart Watch, but have always questioned its accuracy and think the ring is probably more accurate. Got it mainly to track sleep and find it very comfortable to wear (played around with the sizing kit to choose the best finger and size for comfort and am very pleased). Once size was submitted, the ring arrived very quickly. The app paired with my phone easily and is very easy to navigate. Love only having to charge weekly!

Title: I love everything about my RingConn!
Content:
I love everything about my RingConn!
I love that there is no charge for the app.
I love how light the ring is compared to the Ora ring.
I love how it gives me detailed information about my sleep such as my rem sleep , deep sleep , heart rate , and light sleep among other details.
The first thing I check in the morning is my sleep score.
This has helped me with getting to bed at an earlier time and has helped me cut way back on alcohol because it drastically affects your sleep score.
When I drink wine or stay up to late my sleep score is in the 60’s and my deep sleep and rem sleep are less than an hour.
Otherwise it’s in the high 80’s and mid 90’s and my deep sleep and rem sleep are over 2 hours each.
I love that it tracks all my steps without having to have my phone attached to me.
The only downside is ,it took 7 weeks for me to receive it. I guess it comes from overseas . It was definitely worth the wait . I love it!

Title: Ring that never arrived
Content:
After making a purchase, I've been waiting over a month for a ring that never arrived. Supposedly sent on 21.10, track has been lost on 29.10 somewhere in Holland. RingConn didn't resolve it, did not send another piece, and could not even say when it would be sent. I got the feeling that the company forced me to cancel as the price for the ring has been raised lately, so it's better for RingConn to sell a piece for $387 to another person instead of sending it to me, as I took faith in the company and made a preorder. So I've cancelled the order and now I am waiting for my money to be returned.
Contact is artificial and lacks real information. Very bad experience, I cannot recommend buying from RingConn from anyone from my friend, unless they surprise me by something in the end.
