Title: Awesome ring!
Content: This ring packs a powerful punch, so don’t let the size fool you. I bought a lot of smart rings to test a lot of them out and this one by far is the best in the market! First thing is I like that it’s thin because that makes a huge difference since some of them are just so thick, It’s uncomfortable to work with. Battery life is exactly what they State, it lasts just about two weeks or so. Other rings if they’re constantly running in the background like measuring heart rate or pulse ox. For example, it drains the battery like crazy but this ring does not. To me there’s no point of wearing a smart ring If it’s not going to constantly measure the details without dying so quick. The price of the ring to me is pretty fair considering what you’re expecting to work out of a good item. The saying you buy cheap you get cheap is exactly the case with all these smart rings. And the material they make this out of does not damage easily at all, which is another big plus for me if you are rough. The measurements are very accurate because I put it to the test; since I work in the medical field, it makes it a little bit easier to measure things. So overall, this is an excellent ring to keep track of things If you don’t always want to use your Apple Watch or any smart watch for that matter. I have used this for a few months now, so I can accurately measure If it lives up to the expectations.The only thing I hope that they add in the next software update would just be to measure blood pressure. Since all the other smart rings do that and for this one measuring everything under the sun, they just didn’t add blood pressure check. So I hope to see that shortly, but looking forward to the third generation whenever it comes out!

Title: Disappointed... lack of support & service
Content:
I’m quite disappointed with the service. I ordered the RingConn Gen 2, but instead of the correct sizing kit, your team sent me the Gen 1 sizing kit. When I tried to resolve this through your support team, they took days to respond. When they finally did, they instructed me to place an order using the Gen 1 sizing kit.
Following their advice, I ordered a size 12, but it feels a size larger. If I had been provided the correct Gen 2 sizing kit, I might have chosen a size 11 instead, as the thinner design of Gen 2 offers less resistance.
To make matters worse, the package was supposed to include the ring protector, but it wasn’t included. After reaching out again, I received the wrong size protector (M instead of L for a size 12 ring). At this point, I didn’t even bother contacting support again—I’m simply too exhausted and frustrated by the repeated mistakes and lack of accountability.

Title: Great Ring
Content:
Nice looking, light weight and accurate information from this ring. I don’t care for wearing watches so this was a perfect alternative.
The only negative is the advertised 10 day battery life is more like 5-6 days…but still way better than my old smart watch which had less than a day life.
Overall I am very satisfied!

Title: Comfortable, Easy, Great
Content:
I’ve been using Ringconn for almost a month now and I’m really impressed with it. I wear it everyday and only take it off to shower but you can keep it on. The app being free and extremely detailed was a big plus when I bought the ring. The ring is comfortable on any finger and I got used to it in 3 days. I would 100% recommend using the sizing guide as the rings run smaller than standard ring sizes.

Overall, it’s a great purchase and worth the money. I especially love the sleep function and all the information provided about how long I slept, my temperature, oxygen levels, and even sleep abnormalities.

Title: HORRIBLE PRODUCT AND HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE
Content:
I bought the 1st generation ring. I have only had it 14 months and the battery is lasting less than a day. I have reset it and tried the other "fixes" their unhelpful customer service gave to no avail. And by the way, it takes 2-3 days to get a response from customer service even on an issue they are working. They finally offered me a $90 discount off a a new ring which is just ridiculous. 14 months and it is malfunctioning!!! And
I have seen so many reviews where there are technical or other problems with the ring and the company won't remedy. I DO NOT recommend. Try UltraHuman or Oura. I am trying one of those since I have read that their customer service is so much better.

Again, this is a gadget, not a medical device.
I like it ntl and it can surely provide a rough overview of what you go through through the day so you are enabled to move more or take yourself back a bit for relaxation.

Title: You forget it is even there
Content: I’ve been using smartwatches for over nine years. While I appreciated the fitness metrics and health data they offered, I didn’t like not being able to wear a stylish automatic watch. Plus, the constant notifications on my wrist became an unnecessary distraction. RingConn has resolved these issues for me, and I’m thrilled with the experience so far. The standout features are the excellent fit and finish, the comprehensive fitness and health data, and the app’s intuitive presentation. Highly recommended!

Title: Buyer beware
Content: Buyer beware: I think the tech side of this ring is great, however, if you have an issue best of luck to you. My ring size was different than the sizing kit resulting in the need for an exchange. The reply I received? "Sorry, demand is too high for us to help you." And, the 14 day "return policy" is NO returns - and IF the package was damaged before you received it the company MAY chose to help you. This is no "14 day return"policy. Again- cool product IF all the stars align for you. Anybody want to swap a Gen 2 size 11 or 13 for a 10?

Title: Great data, good hardware, awful UI.
Content:
The hardware seems to work as expected and I had no problems with delivery. The battery life is insanely good. The ring is very slim and comfortable. The weak point is the paint (matte black). It is already starting to scuff after only a week. I was hoping it was more robust. I also wish they had a size 15 ring. The 14 does not fit my index or middle fingers. The recent UI update is atrocious.

I originally chose RingConn because it was efficient at showing simple raw data. I was willing to put up with a beta interface assuming it would become more professional and exceed competitors.

The recent UI update is inefficient with the data, and the beta AI w/emojis, smiley faces, and colorful flowers doesn’t match the rings original audience. The AI literally just tells you what you see if you saw the data charts. The UI change feels like a bait and switch from the original portrayal of the app software.

Besides being silly looking, If someone has blurry vision or color blindness, the butt-leaf clover is very difficult to work with compared to the previous diamond. It looks blurry, and is a downgrade in function.

Hopefully RingConn fixes it soon.

Content: I bought the ringconn ring, and tried to cancel it before it shipped. They told me it shipped and they couldn't cancel the order but would send a return label when it arrived. I seriously don't know what to do -- speechless of such a terrible customer service experience for a new startup company. Go with Oura, which my partner has, their customer service is great. RingConn is a con.

Title: Inaccurate data
Content:
have had the “Smart Ring” RingConn for about 2 months.
My first impression is that the ring is well made and
seems to have some sophisticated technology.
Simply put the functions as indicated on the Ring main screen are sleep, Stress,
activity, and heart Rate. It provides a lot of data on each function.
Personally I find the data almost overwhelming and squeezed together.
What I have found, in my brief time, with the Ring is that under Activity, (Steps)
is that they are inaccurate. I have a pedometer and an apple watch and they both
record similar readings in steps taken. Also the ring does not provide distance for
the Steps. If you know how many steps you should know the approximate distance.
The RingConn is way off, on average 200-600 steps. This is unacceptable
and I would think “Skews” the data on other applications on the Ring.
The “Heart rate”(BPM) is also suspect during activity. No clear way to test except by my
Watch and that indicates a discrepancy.
I am disappointed that the Ring does not capture the most basis function of exercise(steps)
in an accurate manner and heart rate.
I did contact RingConn about the steps issue and got a response promptly but
the answer was sort of undefined and in no way an answer to solving the issue.
I have “reset” the Ring several times but that did not change the accuracy of the steps.
I will try it for a little while longer then I will have chalk this up to some devices are
not up to the task.
I would not buy this ring if you expect it to record the basic function of tracking your
Exercise (Steps) or even distance and perhaps heart rate during activity.

DM
CleanText: have had the smart ring ringconn for about months my first impression is that the ring is well made and seems to have some sophisticated technology simply put the functions as indicated on the ring main screen are sleep stress activity and heart rate it provides a lot of data on each function personally i find the data almost overwhelming and squeezed together what i have found in my brief time with the ring is that under activity steps is that they are inaccurate i have a pedometer and an apple watch and they both record similar readings in steps taken also the ring does not provide distance for the steps if you know how many steps you should know the approximate distance the ringconn is way off on average steps this is unacceptable and i would think skews the data on other applications on the ring the heart ratebpm is also suspect during activity no clear way to test except by my watch and that indicates a discrepancy i am disappointed that the ring does not capture the most basis function of exercisesteps in an accurate manner and heart rate i did contact ringconn about the steps issue and got a response promptly but the answer was sort of undefined and in no way an answer to solving the issue i have reset the ring several times but that did not change the accuracy of the steps i will try it for a little while longer then i will have chalk this up to some devices are not up to the task i would not buy this ring if you expect it to record the basic function of tracking your exercise steps or even distance and perhaps heart rate during activity dm

Title: Good gadget to track your sleep
Content:
The Ring looks pretty good (obv. not as good as a accessory ring). The Appdesign is good and easy to understand.
It monitors sleep, HR and SpO2 very well. The HRV can only be measured precisely if ur hand is not moving. Accordingly, i don't know how much you can put on the stress index which the ring calculates based on the HRV which can't be recorded accurately during the day with all the movement.
The ring also overestimates the amount of steps taken, which is shown by the difference in steps measured by my phone and by the ring.
Also be aware, that the ring of the sizing kit is (i can only talk about my order) a little smaller than the actual ring.

I bought the ring to monitor my sleep, which is tracked very good, but only 4 stars due to sizing kit not being acurate and the HRV measuring as well as the overestimation of the steps (which for me is not very relevant)

Title: Never again!
Content:
As Backer #304, I completed my payment instantly and filled out the Pledgebox on September 20, 2024. Despite fulfilling my obligations promptly, the shipment was only initiated on October 1, 2024—10 days later. The product was supposed to arrive by the end of September at the latest. However, it was only after I filed a complaint that the shipment was even started, which is completely unacceptable.

This level of delay and lack of proactive communication is highly unprofessional. I had high hopes for this project, but based on my experience, I cannot recommend doing business with this company.

They asked questions and attempted to resolve the issue but ultimately replaced the ring once they determined that it had failed prematurely.

Five starts for Rigconn for their ring and their customer service.

Title: The ring is very stylish and comfortable!
Content:
The ring is very stylish and comfortable to wear and gives some great insights into my main interests of concern ie sleep, heart rate, and O2 levels.

One discrepancy I'm finding is the ring is struggling to differentiate between me sitting in my chair quietly watching television and me being asleep in my bed.

For this reason, I have stopped wearing my ring 24 hours per day to get a more accurate picture of my sleep hours.

My only other wish would be that there could also be a web-based app rather than just a phone app.

Given the average age of the user probably points towards the older end of the scale, it would simply make it easier for my generation to be able to expand their readings and drill down more into their results to get a better understanding of them.

The recharging case that allows you to recharge the ring at least a dozen times without needing to connect to an outlet is a real plus too.
Waterproof, thin, resistant, super fast synchronization.
Really nice

Title: Bad data, even worse customer service.
Content:
I purchased a RingConn in the spring and was deeply disappointed in my experience. I was promised accurate data, and it could not be more off. I was up with a sick child all night and my sleep score was "excellent" even though I barely slept. I tried to return it the first week I got it, but RingConn never responded to my email and deleted my Instagram comments. I also ordered a ring protector from them the day it arrived and realized after 3 weeks it never even shipped.

I tried appealing it with my CC company, but was recently rejected for the ring, however received a refund (from the CC company) for the ring protector.

RingConn is serious about their return policy which shows me they know they have an inferior product that they do not stand behind. I highly recommend NOT purchasing this product and going with one of the better competitors!

I recently purchased an OuraRing instead and am loving the accurate data provided!

Title: I was recommended Ring(type) health from my Chiropractor
Content:
I was recommended a Ring(type) health device from my chiropracticor. She has the Oura Ring and has consistently showed me her data and differences when we compare. I prefer the RingConn because of the value, fit, and also I appreciate the data. I think the data, user face, and the notifications can be improved. It is a tad bit cumbersome to navigate and the data while interesting isn't as informative with suggestions, ideas to progress/improve and variable options/suggestions of "how" to improve and why. While I fully understand this is not necessarily a health product that supplements professional advice etc. I think the RingConn does have room for improvement in this area. Particularly for those of various levels of fitness, age, and interest in health (whether light go-with-the flow or aggressively trying to improve their health). Overall, the look, fit, and battery-life etc is wonderful.

Context of the reviewer (me), I am 34 years old. Moderately active (played sports most my life, generally relatively weekly active with hikes, walks, sports, etc about 2/wk or more.

Looking forward to more future improvements, thanks for an awesome product!
CleanText: i was recommended a ringtype health device from my chiropracticor she has the oura ring and has consistently showed me her data and differences when we compare i prefer the ringconn because of the value fit and also i appreciate the data i think the data user face and the notifications can be improved it is a tad bit cumbersome to navigate and the data while interesting isnt as informative with suggestions ideas to progressimprove and variable optionssuggestions of how to improve and why while i fully understand this is not necessarily a health product that supplements professional advice etc i think the ringconn does have room for improvement in this area particularly for those of various levels of fitness age and interest in health whether light gowiththe flow or aggressively trying to improve their health overall the look fit and batterylife etc is wonderful context of the reviewer me i am years old moderately active played sports most my life generally relatively weekly active with hikes walks sports etc about wk or more looking forward to more future improvements thanks for an awesome product

Title: Ring looks/feels good, accuracy suspect
Content:
I like the look of the ring. However, the sleep monitoring does not seem to be accurate in terms of when I’m awake and not awake. The other night I laid awake for over an hour but that time was tracked as asleep.

Also, I do high intensity work out classes and it doesn’t seem to recognize those sessions other than an elevated heart rate.

The Activity choices leave a lot to be desired as well. I know they are in Beta testing so I’m hoping that will improve soon.

Title: Minor issues, overall satisfied
Content: Overall, I think the ring is great. Getting the sizing kit was crucial and my ring got to me quickly. Title: What a good surprise!
Content:
Very good device. Easy to manage and comfortable to wear.
With the option to receive first the ring measure kit you couldn’t miss your right size. I toke almost one week before decide which size is the right one for me. I would wear the sample during my day’s activity to be sure it doesn’t get me uncomfortable and stressed.
I’m not sure about the reliable of the steps count, but I think they will improve the software time by time.
The external surface is well finished end seems enough scratch resistant for daily normal use.
You can wear without mind in your bath activities as it’s water resistant and neutral soap safe.
What to say to close this review, the device is well done, well finished and well designed.
Well well well, thanks ringconn.
Cheers, Francesco.

Content: The ring itself is great and records the data properly, but the app needs to be improved. For example, the manually activated sports activities do not include training in enclosed buildings. Title: RingConn works hard for its Customers
Content:
I have been using the ring since its inception, and with messenger we have built a strong community of people who help each other, and RingConn listens to what our concerns are. They are constantly improving the app, and now have had beta testers including me, to help in adding more and more functionality to the ring.

It has really improved in the sleep area immensely. That is why I bought it initially. It gives you a multitude of information about the quality of your sleep and it now adding sleep apnea for those who need it.

Where it needs the most improvement and it is working hard to do that, is tracking your exercise accurately. Whether on a bike or just walking they keep adding more yet the accuracy really still lags in many of those programs.

I can speak to the walking. I am 6' tall and long legged, and I can walk a mile in under 13 minutes, yet a 50 minute walk that my iPhone shows 3.8 miles, their beta app is showing only 2.8 miles quite a difference. The algorythym still needs a lot work, maybe they need to build in your height stride or whatever to get it more accurate, I will leave it to their programmers.

They are always willing to listen and improve, go out and buy this ring, you will not be disappointed!
CleanText: i have been using the ring since its inception and with messenger we have built a strong community of people who help each other and ringconn listens to what our concerns are they are constantly improving the app and now have had beta testers including me to help in adding more and more functionality to the ring it has really improved in the sleep area immensely that is why i bought it initially it gives you a multitude of information about the quality of your sleep and it now adding sleep apnea for those who need it where it needs the most improvement and it is working hard to do that is tracking your exercise accurately whether on a bike or just walking they keep adding more yet the accuracy really still lags in many of those programs i can speak to the walking i am tall and long legged and i can walk a mile in under minutes yet a minute walk that my iphone shows miles their beta app is showing only miles quite a difference the algorythym still needs a lot work maybe they need to build in your height stride or whatever to get it more accurate i will leave it to their programmers they are always willing to listen and improve go out and buy this ring you will not be disappointed

Title: I honestly love it
Content: I honestly love it! I mainly wanted to track my steps and sleep and I've been very happy with the stats - turns out I'm not sleeping as well as I thought I was! I'm glad there was the option for the free sizing kit because I tested out a few different sizes on different fingers before I made a final decision. The ring is slim and I like the squared shape, it feels very natural. The biggest thing I am blow away by is the battery life - I charge it once a week and forget about it otherwise. My smartwatch didn't even last a full day let alone day and night!

Title: Bigger Size please
Content:
The RingCoon ring offers good quality and efficient battery management. The accompanying app is straightforward, which is beneficial as it covers all necessary functions without any unnecessary complexity. However, the widgets are redundant since they merely mirror the app's windows; it’s easier to open the app, sync, and check progress directly.

One drawback is the need to send data to the cloud for any results. The phone or app should process basic data locally, with cloud connectivity reserved for more detailed insights. Additionally, push notifications for ring software updates would be helpful. While frequent app usage might be encouraged for data collection, a notification for updates would benefit standard or IT users who sync less frequently.

Moreover, a larger size option would be awesome, as even the size 14 feels a bit small.
CleanText: the ringcoon ring offers good quality and efficient battery management the accompanying app is straightforward which is beneficial as it covers all necessary functions without any unnecessary complexity however the widgets are redundant since they merely mirror the apps windows its easier to open the app sync and check progress directly one drawback is the need to send data to the cloud for any results the phone or app should process basic data locally with cloud connectivity reserved for more detailed insights additionally push notifications for ring software updates would be helpful while frequent app usage might be encouraged for data collection a notification for updates would benefit standard or it users who sync less frequently moreover a larger size option would be awesome as even the size feels a bit small

Title: Not useful
Content: The ring took weeks to receive, which is unacceptable. The app is not giving me any useful analysis for my health and I don’t see you making useful software or UI updates. I expected a monthly release at the minimum. I expected more from this ring. I’ve been fully rested, sick, completely stressed, and run marathons, but the app doesn’t tell me anything about my condition. It even says I’m inactive when I have recorded workouts on my Apple Watch… what a stupid and easy thing you could fix but choose not to build.

Title: Still on the fence...
Content:
Still on the fence...
Look, feel, design of the ring, and battery length is fabulous- would highly recommend on these aspects alone. However, when it comes to obtaining the metrics and understanding how the insights are derived, this ring leaves a lot to be desired. I have had this for a couple of months now and was eager to have the oxygen and stress readings to keep track of some health issues. Sadly, 90% of the time the ring does not capture readings for many of the metrics, and I still have no understanding of how any of the insights related to stress are gathered. Readings that are captured appear to be off as well- for example "Stress" readings and "exercise mode" just don't seem to be tracking correctly.

Title: In general I like the product
Content:
In general I like the product. I went through 3 Wellue rings before trying this. It holds the charge as claimed which is amazing. It charges in 90 minutes or less as claimed, also amazing. The water resistant aspect is my most favorite part as I think I lost at least two of the previous brand because of that. I love that it is not bulky and looks like normal jewelry. I find most of the readings accurate when they are taken.

The things I would change if I could. Continuous readings for oxygen and heart rate. For some of us that are chronically ill, it is important to know in lass than 5 minutes if our oxygen drops. Along those lines, notifications when we have readings outside of certain settings. These are huge and frankly, I wouldn’t have bought the ring if I had more clearly understood. If it can send sedentary notifications, it should be able to send others. The sleep recording is way off. I am chronically ill. On really bad days I am sedentary for the better part of the day. The ring records that as sleep - and not just sleep, but deep sleep and REM sleep. This doesn’t seem appropriate.

I think this is a great product and hopefully with some updates and tweaks along the way it will be an amazing product.

Title: Good So Far
Content: So far, my ring has been very good. The sizing and delivery was as advertised. I am very pleased with that. The ring case had a good charge when delivered, and it did not take a lot of time to charge the ring. It was easy to get everything installed, updated and operating. I put it into the case to charge when showering, and it stays close to 100%. But some tweaks are still necessary. The first day I cut the grass with a push mower. This registered as taking a nap. Also, I walk several Km daily and the "outdoor walking" selection on the app is not yet active, so my ring has yet to record any exercise. It does count my steps, a bit more freely than my phone pedometer app. Google Fit records my route, not the ring. I have not had any updates since receiving my ring, so I hope these anomalies are corrected. My sleep and other reading appear accurate. It is comfortable to wear. I am quite happy with my RingConn, and hope further updates can address some of the limitations and glitches I have noted.
CleanText: so far my ring has been very good the sizing and delivery was as advertised i am very pleased with that the ring case had a good charge when delivered and it did not take a lot of time to charge the ring it was easy to get everything installed updated and operating i put it into the case to charge when showering and it stays close to but some tweaks are still necessary the first day i cut the grass with a push mower this registered as taking a nap also i walk several km daily and the outdoor walking selection on the app is not yet active so my ring has yet to record any exercise it does count my steps a bit more freely than my phone pedometer app google fit records my route not the ring i have not had any updates since receiving my ring so i hope these anomalies are corrected my sleep and other reading appear accurate it is comfortable to wear i am quite happy with my ringconn and hope further updates can address some of the limitations and glitches i have noted

Title: Lightweight and surprisingly comfortable
Content:
Lightweight and surprisingly comfortable to wear! Battery lasts essentially forever, since I can just top it up when I hop in the shower (you can shower with it just fine though).

No concerns about waterproofing here; it's survived doing dishes dozens of times already without any issues. It's also survived gardening and just general daily abuse. I'm pleasantly surprised with the overall experience.

I mostly just got this for heart rate monitoring and sleep tracking, both of which it does without any issue. I'm pleasantly surprised about their "sedentary notification" feature, which has been a helpful reminder to get up and move about.

Title: I really like my RingConn
Content:
I really like my RingConn. It gives me very helpful information about activity, sleep patterns and other vitals. The sleep information is particularly helpful.

I am looking forward to the swim function as I don't think the translation to "steps" is accurate. . Also - I think its a bit generous with steps so I take my daily count with a grain of salt but its still helpful information even if it might not be absolutely accurate. All in all its a great tool as I continue on my path of continuing good health.

I love the long battery life and very fast charging. Customer service is fast and helpful.

Great product.

Title: Ringconn review
Content: What I like is the convenience. Put it on and forget about it. Being able to shower with it on is great. Stress and sleep measurements work well. The wellness balance suggestions are helpful. What I don't like is the heart rate and step counter measurements. They both only work correctly when your arm is moving. I work out on a stationary bike. I also wear another heart rate monitor on my arm. My other heart rate monitor will be reading 150 for example, however the ring thinks I'm inactive because I have my arms on the handle bars(not moving). I also don't get any credit for steps because my arm is not moving. So I don't get any credit for the whole workout. If you walk or run for exercise the ring is great. I also use a push mower to mow grass on a slopping lot. It is a great workout!! But my heart rate according to the ring will stay around 70 because my arms are on the mower handle(not moving). I also don't get any credit for steps for the same reason(arms not moving). If I take my arm off the bike or mower, the heart rate and steps are correct. Mowing and biking one handed is difficult and not sustainable. I do manage to reach my step goals, but I have to do extra walking or running to achieve it. I really do like the ring. I hope a firmware update will fix these issues.

Title: Everything went very smoothly.
Content: Date of experience: May 13, 2024

Title: Satisfaction Despite Challenges
Content:
Review: Satisfaction Despite Challenges**

I had the pleasure of working with Isla as my guide, and I want to share my positive experience. Isla was always there for me and constantly provided guidance, even when there were issues with the delivery.

Let me detail my experience:

1. **Service**: The overall service was very good. Email response times were excellent, and I always felt well supported and informed.

2. **Delivery**: Delivery was challenging. It took significantly longer than I expected. Personally, I believe this should be communicated more clearly, as I couldn't find any information about the extended delivery times anywhere.

3. **Returns**: Returning items incurs a fee, which is understandable, but it would have been helpful to know this in advance.

4. **Ringconn Gadget App**: The app has room for improvement, from my perspective. More customer data might be needed to further optimize it.

5. **Overall Picture**: Despite some challenges, I'm overall satisfied with the experience. Isla's assistance played a significant role in this.

6. **Appreciation**: Dear Isla, you are the best. Thank you for your tireless efforts and excellent support.

Overall, I had a positive experience and can recommend the service—especially thanks to Isla.

Title: One of the best rings on the market.
Content:
The app and ring connect together pretty well, and I haven’t seen any connection issues that aren’t resolved with a quick restart of the app. Sleep, stress and BPM/SP02 data is nicely laid out and the implications of the numbers are easy to understand. Not having to pay a subscription fee for the app is also a definite plus.
That said, it would be nice to partition sleep data over a single sleep period if possible. For example, if I go to sleep at 11 PM, wake up at 2 AM, and go back to sleep from 4 AM to 6 AM, the ring counts this as one continuous block of sleep from 11 - 6, which makes data inaccurate.

Content:
10 hours after ordering, and three weeks before receiving the product there was a new price. I contacted the supplier about this, since I wanted to get the better price too - especially given theming lead time. Did not get a response to this day.

Title: I like the health benefits
Content:
I like the health benefits. Especially the sleep, heart, and activity monitoring features.

The ring app is intuitive.

The ring is a bit chunky. Seems that if you can have all of the same features in a smaller ring, then this size, 13, could have a thinner form.

So far I’ve washed dishes and showered in the ring and it seems fine. Water proof enough for me.

I also wear it as I work and play: welding (with gloves) , masonry, carpet removal/installation, framing carpentry, halibut fishing, boating,

Battery life is ok. I look forward to a movement-powered ring. Like my watch.

The charger is good.

Title: 24 days to receive correct ring in NZ but good customer service
Content: After I placed my order it took about 10 days shipping from HK to NZ which is expected. However when I received the sizing kit I also received a default size 6 silver ring. I figured out that when I placed my order somehow the RingConn shopping cart didn't remove the default size 6 silver ring when I chose "don't know my size". Customer service responded the same day but it took a couple of days for them to arrange a pre-paid courier ticket for me to return the ring. Initially they wouldn't send the correct ring I wanted until they received it back in HK but after some pushing they conceded and shipped the correct ring. Again it took about 10 days. Overall from date of order to receiving the correct ring was 24 days which is disappointing but Customer service were communicative and overwhelmingly apologetic for the error which is appreciated when things do go wrong. Initial use of the ring and the app for 5 days is good so far.

Title: RingConn has a long way to go to bring their customer service up to par
Content:
So far the ring performs as advertised. I wish I could give it a better rating but the issues I had with customer service overshadowed the experience in ways I won’t soon forget.

My ring was lost in shipping and the support group at RingConn was slow, unhelpful and condescending in handling my issue. After many messages to support and responses that were days late or failed to address my issue, RingConn finally agreed to ship me a new ring. I requested overnight shipment to make up for the lost time and frustration I experienced and they disregarded my request completely, instead sending a new ring three days later via USPS. They repeatedly disregarded my request to have a supervisor contact me.

Several days later I received two rings on consecutive days. No sooner had the second ring arrived than I began getting urgent messages from RingConn to return it. They asked me to take it to a shipping location which I refused to do. I used a shipping label they provided and left it out for my postman to pick up.

I have rarely experienced such incompetent service nor have I been disregarded as completely as I was by RingConn. I was far more diligent in sending back the second ring than they were in addressing my concerns. I only hope I don’t have an issue with the ring, since I have no confidence RingConn will stand behind their product.

Follow up 05/27/2024:
I received a lengthy response from RingConn after posting my review. Like all their communications, it was vague and did not address my concerns. I have dealt with online sellers of many products for decades and have never been treated so disrespectfully. I've wasted enough time on this. I should have purchased an OURA!!!
CleanText: so far the ring performs as advertised i wish i could give it a better rating but the issues i had with customer service overshadowed the experience in ways i wont soon forget my ring was lost in shipping and the support group at ringconn was slow unhelpful and condescending in handling my issue after many messages to support and responses that were days late or failed to address my issue ringconn finally agreed to ship me a new ring i requested overnight shipment to make up for the lost time and frustration i experienced and they disregarded my request completely instead sending a new ring three days later via usps they repeatedly disregarded my request to have a supervisor contact me several days later i received two rings on consecutive days no sooner had the second ring arrived than i began getting urgent messages from ringconn to return it they asked me to take it to a shipping location which i refused to do i used a shipping label they provided and left it out for my postman to pick up i have rarely experienced such incompetent service nor have i been disregarded as completely as i was by ringconn i was far more diligent in sending back the second ring than they were in addressing my concerns i only hope i dont have an issue with the ring since i have no confidence ringconn will stand behind their product follow up i received a lengthy response from ringconn after posting my review like all their communications it was vague and did not address my concerns i have dealt with online sellers of many products for decades and have never been treated so disrespectfully ive wasted enough time on this i should have purchased an oura

Title: Customer service TERRIBLE
Content:
I got my ring a little over a month ago. It stopped holding a charge already. You submit your concern through the app, but it usually takes 2 days for them to get back to you. They said that they would send me a return label two days ago, all I needed to do was confirm my address and that I am ready to mail it. I confirmed, but then they e-mail back today asking me to confirm my ring size (so I'm sure they won't get back to me for another 2 days). It just seems they drag things out quite a bit. I haven't been able to use my ring for 10 days - and will be much longer at the rate of their customer service.

Update June 2: Due to the poor customer service, I requested a refund. On May 22, they said my refund was of “utmost importance” and that they would be following it “very closely”. They said I should get it in 2-3 business days. But after 7 business days, I still have yet to receive my refund.

Quite honestly - the customer service (or lack thereof) should be enough to discourage anyone from purchasing this ring.

Title: I love the ring
Content:
I love the ring, it's a great aid for keeping track of any sleep issues you may be having. Heart rate, blood oxygen level, heart rate variability, rem and deep sleep durations, stress levels, activity...
Make sure the ring fits snuggly to get the best results.
My only complaints would be they don't have it working well with workouts in the gym, but they are working on that, and sometimes I get weird stress readings, like highly stressed when I'm laying down reading, or in the middle of sleeping, but overall it's a great ring.

Title: Loving the Ring
Content: I've had several smart watches, but I hate wearing a watch so I just didn't bother and they just never really felt accurate. I finally switched to Ring and absolutely love it. It's out of the way, decorative, but not blingy, and it works. I feel the step counts are far more accurate, the sleep stuff is fascinating and enlightening, heart rate, oxygen, and all that are easy to read. I'm most enjoying the Stress sensor, I love to drive but the Ring has shown me how stressed I am while driving. I can see it now, but I had no idea at the time. Well worth the money.

Title: Latest App Update a Disaster.
Content: For several months I found the ring to be very helpful in analyzing my sleep. The data provided me with a chart of my sleep stages during the night. Within the past few weeks however the app was "updated" and I no longer have access to the sleep data chart, only a single number, telling me my total sleep for the night. No more data telling me the amount of light sleep. deep sleep, and REM sleep. I sent in a request to have the problem fixed but the reply was totally unsatisfactory, telling me it would be fixed with the next upgrade. That might be months, if at all. I bought the ring based on the data presentation that I was initially provided, not on the very abbreviated presentation I now have. I have no idea why the company would take such a huge step backward. I did not buy the ring based on the skimpy data that is now provided. I have no choice but to demand a return of my money.

Title: Sizing ring and actual ring are different sizes!
Content: I bought my ring for Christmas of 2023 and while I'm happy with the data the ring collects, the accuracy of all the metrics, the battery life, and the fact that I get to wear cute bracelets again... I'm disappointed with the sizing kit and the customer service. I wore the size 9 and the size 10 sample rings for 2 weeks on my index finger and ordered a size 10 in silver. When I got my actual ring, it was way too big for my index finger and kept sliding off. I reached out to the company to see if I could return it for a size 9 (I did know that all sales are final, but I explained that the ring wasn't the same size as the sizing ring) and was told no and to try a different finger. I do wear my ring on my middle finger because the ring wasn't cheap, but it looks awful! I even have the sizing ring still and when I hold both rings together, there is a noticeable difference in the actual ring and the sizing ring.

Title: Overall experience was great
Content:
Overall experience was great. Purchased it over their website, and first I got a sizing kit. After two days wearing/testing on fingers, just choose your size and you get your ring after some days. In my case was pretty fast, less than 10 days.
Ring works amazing. I love how handles the sleep/nap and stress. It's pretty light, battery lasts for a week and app was translated recently to Spanish so can't be more happy with it.
I wear my RingConn and feeling like I wasn't. Sometimes I forget I wear it! It's amazing how many information can we get from such a device like this.
I am very happy about it!

Title: My experiences after half a year of use
Content: The ring is almost unnoticeable. The ring battery lasts 6 days. The charging box also includes a battery and you can charge the ring in the box several times before you have to charge the box's battery. Ideal if you are traveling without electricity for several weeks. The ring has integrated memory and does not have to be permanently connected to the cell phone. When the connection is restored, the measurement data is sent to the cell phone and the cloud. The app is very clear and easy to understand. The positive thing is that it doesn't require a subscription and the app is therefore free. The app is available in multiple languages and Ring Conn is constantly working to improve the app. You can actively start measurements yourself in the app. Ring Conn Support always strives to provide a solution to questions as quickly as possible. I can recommend this product with a clear conscience. I hope I was able to answer a few questions for those interested in the recession. Greetings David
CleanText: the ring is almost unnoticeable the ring battery lasts days the charging box also includes a battery and you can charge the ring in the box several times before you have to charge the boxs battery ideal if you are traveling without electricity for several weeks the ring has integrated memory and does not have to be permanently connected to the cell phone when the connection is restored the measurement data is sent to the cell phone and the cloud the app is very clear and easy to understand the positive thing is that it doesnt require a subscription and the app is therefore free the app is available in multiple languages and ring conn is constantly working to improve the app you can actively start measurements yourself in the app ring conn support always strives to provide a solution to questions as quickly as possible i can recommend this product with a clear conscience i hope i was able to answer a few questions for those interested in the recession greetings david

Title: 6-months review…
Content: I’ve had my RingConn ring for exactly 6 months now. It has given very reliable results over this time period with no significant problems, particularly helping me track sleep and steps. The step-tracking feature has definitely been a helpful motivator in getting me active most every day. Although I did need to learn exactly how it was measuring ‘steps’ - which was not the number of times my feet touched the ground, but was actually the number of times my arms would swing freely as I walked. For instance I did need to learn to carry my grocery bag with my right hand in the store and let my left (ring) hand swing freely, if I wanted my shopping walking to count. But it’s basically been an extremely effective - and also very unobtrusive - device for helping me monitor these health & wellness functions.
CleanText: ive had my ringconn ring for exactly months now it has given very reliable results over this time period with no significant problems particularly helping me track sleep and steps the steptracking feature has definitely been a helpful motivator in getting me active most every day although i did need to learn exactly how it was measuring steps which was not the number of times my feet touched the ground but was actually the number of times my arms would swing freely as i walked for instance i did need to learn to carry my grocery bag with my right hand in the store and let my left ring hand swing freely if i wanted my shopping walking to count but its basically been an extremely effective and also very unobtrusive device for helping me monitor these health wellness functions

Title: Ring Benefits
Content: The people I worked with were very knowledgeable and understanding. They took the time to answer my questions directly and provided me with the best product possible. I am using my Ring for weight loss and maintenance. It keeps a detailed measurement of my steps, heart rate, and O2 levels. The ring is so accurate my doctor is using the data collected to help monitor my sleep patterns and stress levels. I recently had surgery, and the Ring is a great way to monitor my activity levels as I slowly gain more mobility and endurance.

Title: Happy but missing activity tracking
Content: The ring is comfortable and I like it more than wearing a smart watch. Title: I've had it for 6 months now and I love…
Content: I've had it for 6 months now and I love it. I can't really compare with Oura because I never had one but RingConn has made consistent upgrades to the application improving it tremendously in just 6mo. I love how long the battery lasts and the consistency of the measurements. I also wear an Apple watch and there are big gaps in the data since the watch can be finicky about lighting (for heart rate). but the ring is well-sized for my finger and keeps giving me data. I especially appreciate the stress measurement. When I see it go orange or read I do try to do some breathing exercises, take a walk or just relax a bit and reframe my mind.

Title: Take control of your health
Content: I ordered the Ringconn, because, once purchased, I did not need to pay a monthly subscription for access to my biometric information. Ringconn sends you a ring measuring kit and once l submit my size, I waited 10 days for delivery of my stylish and data-rich ring. The ring measures a variety of biometrics and provides explanations for the information provided. I wear it daily, and use the readings to adjust activity, manage stress, identify sleep patterns, a variety of other health related information. The ring is amazing and worth the cost.

Title: RingConn the best smart ring with no subscription
Content:
Had ring from early days in Feb 2023 14 months on and this ring is fantastic - there are regular updates in app and firmware each one creating a better experience.

Also this ring has No Subscription which I love, all updates free

Found the vitals/ Heart Rate - HRV-Spo2 oxygen Sleep to be extremely accurate when testing against other equipment I have.
Sleep Apnea is under testing as is fertility tracking as I write this review

Overall this ring has made a massive difference how I track my health- don’t use Apple Watch for that anymore - no more bulky watch at night for sleep tracking- each day i track my vitals to see how I’m doing,

Love the customer care team and feedback team - very proactive - they have a great group where everyone asks questions and give their views and RingConn interact directly with people in group on Facebook

Overall 5 stars - love the ring and regular updates wether young and healthy for sports tracking or older like myself - I find this ring a great asset for tracking my health - well done RingConn for being proactive in developing this ring and keeping on top-with regular updates

Look forward to seeing more additions to an already brilliant ring with further updates

Title: A great concept that could use improvements
Content:
1- the lack of half sizes was a problem for me. I had to choose either a ring that was too tight or two loose. When I contacted the company for help, they were very noncommittal, basically telling me that neither would be a good idea. Well, duh. I ultimately decided on too loose because I still wanted to be able to get the ring off if I was bloated or on a hot day. That resulted in nearly losing the ring a couple of times on very cold days because it fell right off my finger! I finally solved this by purchasing a very thin, cheap ring in my size from Amazon which I wear on top of my RingConn to keep it from falling off.

2- the Wellness Balance is not explained clearly. I check it, but other than my sleep & activity, it's not really intuitive what information I'm getting from my vital signs & stress scores. More info would be more helpful.

3- they started giving wellness badges. Ok. Cool. What exactly am I tracking?

4- I pretty much use this to track my steps. It's a lot more comfortable than an apple watch.

5- I do appreciate being able to use the app without a subscription, which is why I chose this over another ring on the market.

Bottom line- I like it. But I can't say I love it. It's a great concept that could use some improvements.

Title: Probably the best smart ring out there
Content:
I needed a tracker for sleep and was in search for a device, which can help me get some stats without bringing much discomfort by wearing it. Startet to research a market and found out a bunch of smart rings which offer exactly what i need. After long consideretaions i have ordered RingConn and it was a right choice. For me it was importnant that battery lasts long, price/feature ratio is decent and there is no monthly subscription for it.
I was sleeping in sleep laboratory connected to monitoring systems and wearing my Ringconn ring. And results of ring measurements were really close to lab, so i am totally happy with it

I have short, chubby fingers, and this ring draws attention. I have the silver version.

Title: Solid smart-wear device! Can recommend!
Content:
Solid smart wear device! I can recommend this ring. The Ringconn was easy to set up and the app gives you a ton of data. Also seems to be more accurate in a lot of instances than my Fitbit or Samsung Watch, so happy about that as well. 3. Visually, the ring is holding up too (I am a desk worker). No scratches etc. (I have the gold version)
The ordering process was a bit of a hassle due to unclear notifications regarding shipment. I was sent the fitting set twice, but it looked like my ring was shipped. All in all, it took longer than I thought or hoped. Bottomline: I can recommend this wearable!

Title: Amazing ring with a amazing app
Content:
I've had the ring for ≈5 months now and so far I'm very happy with it.

The app is updated very frequently with new features being added. Since I got the ring there has been an updated summary as well as new features to tack outdoor running.

All my contact with the company has been really great as well. I order the protector and received a size small er than I ordered. They quickly corrected their mistake and I got 2 new protector of the correct size a few days later. I even were able to change the size after having submitted a smaller size than I actually wanted.

The ring itself is very nice and both feels and looks great. It's very comfortable to wear and I usually forget that I'm even wearing it. It's great at tracking sleep and over-all activity. Although the downside is that it's quite inaccurate when working out in a gym and the heart rate seems to be far off. But at the same time, it's not an activity tracker and I don't expected it to be as accurate for workouts as a fitness tracker.

Content:

Content:
I've been using my Ringconn for over two months now. I'm really happy with my purchase. The battery lasts all week and the data I get from my sleep and activity has made me be more conscious of my health and what I need to improve. I don't have to worry about subscriptions either in order to take full advantage of the data it produces.
I'm impressed by the design and the high quality material. Very well made.
The charging case is great for traveling since I don't have to plug it in to AC to charge my ring. Overall, a great product at a great reasonable price.

Title: The ring and functionality is exactly as described
Content: The ring and functionality is exactly as advertised, looks and wears great ( I selected black ), has been very durable with no scratches and the syncing function works flawlessly. The app is very user friendly and very informative, activity tracking is great but the sleep and stress tracking have been extremely insightful helping me adjust my day and nights for better sleep. The new achievement badges are great and the soon to be activity functions ( outdoor walk, run, etc. ) will be a great addition. Lastly no monthly subscription is a big 👍, great value for the price, customer service has been excellent. I would recommend RingConn over the other couple of brands.

Content:

Finally thank you for an affordable option!

Title: So Far So Good
Content: My Ring experience has been good so far. I have had my Ring about 5 or 6 months. Fit and delivery were fast and easy. The quality of the ring itself is good and the brushed aluminum finish is nice, subtle and does not scratch very easily. The ring charges quickly and is easy to do using their included pod style charger. I wish syncing was a bit faster or even bet automatic each day. The FREE app is a nice touch for following your information. It is well laid out and easy to read and understand after just a few uses. There have been a continuous stream of updates to the app and ring so that has been a nice upside. Kudos to the dev team! Overall I am very happy with my purchase. My one piece of advice (no matter what ring you purchase is to decide what you are really looking to get out of the information they provide and will you use it to make informed decisions). I'd give it 4.5 stars if I could as it's not perfect but pretty great overall.

I really like wearing all of my rings, (I have many in stainless steel and sterling silver and it blends well with all of them. I constantly get compliments on my rings and they have no idea that one of them is a health tracker until I mention it...IF I do! Lol) so this is a perfect health tracker for me, vs. wrist versions, that I've also had easily break or wear out on me, so I LOVE this option and even more so since they aren't just trying to take advantage with yet another monthly subscription!!! (Which is what made my decision easier!) I've had my ring for about 5 months now and am VERY happy with it! THANK YOU, RingConn!!!

Title: I like the ring overall
Content:
I like the ring overall. It seems to be well built and durable. I haven’t dropped it, but I have exercised at the gym and worked in the garden with it, and it sustained little damage. The only issue I have is that it doesn’t tell me when it needs to charge. I’ve gone through the steps on your support page to remedy the problem, but I haven’t had any success.

At this juncture, the only recommendation I can offer is to fix what I mentioned above and allow the customer the choice to set whether or not they want to receive a daily summary of how they slept the night before. The notification can say something like, “here is your sleep summary from last night.” I often forget to check my dashboard in the morning because I’m busy getting ready for my day. Consequently, I don’t check it until later or forget altogether. Other than that, I think you have a great product, and it is performing as expected. I hope this helps.

Title: Important and useful health tracking information
Content:
The RingConn ring provides important health tracking information on a continuous basis. The app does a good job of presenting this information in a usable and useful way and allows good user interactions.
But some information (e.g., peak heartrate readings) is not as continuous and as accurate as it could be, and some sleep information (e.g., Sleep2) is wrong, requires an app update, and no update has been made.

Title: Neurodivergent helpful - detailed sleep and stress
Content:
The ring is crafted well and never feels too warm or tight/loose with the two bumps, which was something I was worried about before owning it.

What sold me on this ring and why I'm still very happy with it is that I'm a neurodivergent person that struggles with things like severe ADHD and a very common comorbidity of that, Insomnia.

Having a ring that accurately tracks whenever you sleep no matter the time and understands and displays sleep stages has been so useful for me to track and understand so much more about my sleep needs and patterns. Including learning I have my most efficient and restful sleeps with the best ratio of Deep and REM sleep stages when I sleep between 5-6 hours vs more/less hours.

It also tracks stress levels very well that compares and outdoes what my apple watches did for me in the past. But on a ring on my finger instead of a watch that has a poor battery.

It is also been surprisingly durable and waterproof to where I can just forget it is on. I do tend to take it off to charge while I shower, but it's not due to not being able to shower with it on, I just found that to be the most convenient and efficient way to keep my ring charged without interrupting my schedule.

I had issues with my ring not keeping charge more than 3 days after 2 months of use and they without hesitation mailed me a replacement to use within the same week. This second one has kept its charge same as when I first got it and lasts 7 days but I charge mine more often as mentioned so i rarely have to push it unless I just forget to take it off when I shower.

Speaking of the case, it is just great. I rarely ever have to plug in the case to charge. Maybe once a month, or longer?

Very very happy with it. Only improvements I want to see more of is just more features on the app but those are already promised and even within the time of purchasing it until now there have already been new features and bug fixes added routinely which is always a good sign of a healthy app development cycle and a team that is organized and follows agile methodology. (I'm a software engineer, so it's easier to spot 😅).

For the price this is such a good investment for me and I'm happy to have jumped onto the ringconn bandwagon over the others I had researched in comparison.

Excited to see what comes next ✌️

Title: Pretty good ring, but swelling of finger a major issue
Content:
My RingConn ring has been an interesting experience. I purchased this as part of a Black Friday sale. I needed a ring sizing kit, and this was sent to me, although I felt it was dispatched and delivered a bit slowly. I decided on a ring size after wearing the "sizing" ring a couple of days. I wanted the ring to be worn on my non-dominant hand. The ring arrived in a reasonable time after I selected the ring size online. It charged up properly. The set up was okay, but I did feel that RingConn's app was asking for too much personal information such as my home address. It should be asking only for the rock bottom minimum information from the user. My home address is not needed for a health tracking application.

After a time, it became clear to me that the RingConn app installed on my iPhone was rather basic, but it seemed to be sending my health data to a server somewhere on the internet. For example, to get a report of my health data (such as the stress score, sleep trends, step counts) over time, the information appears to be made available from a server. I have no idea if this information is encrypted on the remote server(s) or not and what other parties have access to my personal data...such as my daily sleep patterns.

Even so, for a almost 4 months, it was fun to wear my ring daily, 24 hours a day, except in the shower or when doing some messy chores with my hands like washing dishes. It was fun seeing the trends develop over time. But then, quite recently, a problem developed. The finger that I used for my ring seemed to start swelling. I could not get the ring off easily. Perhaps this is tied to increasing physical activity on my part, or warmer temperatures as the short winter ended and Spring arrived. I am not sure. My skin came off a bit the last time I wrenched the ring off my finger...not a lot of skin...and there was really almost no pain...but there was some minor bleeding that stopped quickly. I decided I had better stop wearing the ring. Recently, my finger has healed enough to put the ring back on, but the fit is so tight that I'm afraid I'll injure the finger again when I need the ring to come off.

So I'm not sure what to do. I wish I could have ordered a quarter-size larger (for example, ring size 9.25 instead of 9) or a half-size larger (as in 9.50.) I have given the ring to my wife, since she is interested in RingConn.

I think that eventually, health tracking rings need to be constructed from flexible materials that can accept some amount of physical expansion or contraction. I think ring materials that are flexible in this way are very necessary for me. I don't understand why my finger swelled, and perhaps it will contract this coming winter with cooler temperatures. But the ring is useless to me if it cannot fit on my finger "just right".

Also, it is important for customers to feel that their personal information is safe; that it will not be sold to third parties for any reason; that it is secured such that even RingConn employees cannot decrypt someone's personal information; that it cannot be decrypted by third parties; and that even if the data is stolen by thieves, it cannot be decrypted by them, either (even if the thieves wait a few years and try to decrypt at that future date.)

Overall, I like the idea of a health tracking ring, but the materials need to be improved and the security of my personal data really needs to be assured.

Title: I love it
Content:
I received my ring just 1 year ago. Since then RingConn has constantly improved their app and I love the feedback. I took a professional sleep test while I was wearing my Apple Watch Ultra and the RingConn. When I showed the sleep tech the Apple and RingConn results, he said the RingConn was more accurate. He responded "How did they do that with only the ring and we need all these sensors?"

When I got the ring the battery lasted for 4 days. Now after constant use of only 1 year the battery will only last a maximum of 2 days. RingConn service contacted me and offered to replace my ring. The replacement was expedited and I am very happy with their service.

Title: I am entirely pleased with my ring
Content:
I am entirely pleased with my ring. It is exactly as described right down to the length of time the battery lasts.
My ring is several months old and looks just like it did when it arrived. I have the Titanium colour and really like how it just looks like a nice simple band.
I have been diagnosed with very severe sleep apnea and this ring is helping me understand my sleep pattterns and the factors that attribute to a good night or a bad nights sleep.
One thing I found quite fascinating was that while I am getting tattoos that my entire system goes right into relax and stays there during my session.
I highly recommend this product for anyone wanting to understand their bodies better.

Title: Decent product and the entire…
Content:
I like the product and the entire purchase was simple and fairly quick. I've had the ring for several months now. As for the actual ring, it works well and holds a charge for about 5 - 7 days depending on usage.

My only criticism is the app. It would be more useful and helpful if the app and associated data was capable of being synchronized with more than just Google Fit and more than just sending data. There is no way for it to receive data really either. It does not sync with any known fitness scales so you cannot add your weight or fitness data.

Title: A very good smartring that keeps evolving
Content:
I have had my ring for about 1/2 year now and have been quite satisfied. The Ringconn app on my phone (android) provides helpful information (heart rate, spo2, steps, and sleep) and trending statistics. Ringconn continues to enhance the product through reasonably frequent updates. The ring charge lasts a week and the charging case will give you a bunch more charges without having to plug it in.

Things that need to continue to evolve:
1. Ability to automatically detect activities (walking, swimming, elliptical, etc.) similar to my Galaxy Watch
2. The charging case needs to have an indicator for when it is fully charged

Title: I have had my ring for 6 months
Content: I have had my ring for 6 months, and insanely impressed so far. Love how they keep updating the app and updating the ring with new features. The battery life is exactly what is advertised, but what surprised me is how quickly it charges. I think this ring is impressive in comparison to fitness trackers (I’ve tried using a handful of devices.) I only have 1 complaint/regret, I purchased the black ring, very quickly all the edges and corners the black color wore off and the surface if scratched leaves a nice silver mark. I wish I would have just ordered the plain metal, I think it would have stood up longer. Either way, have to rate this like a 4.5, only reason not a 5 is because it doesn’t stay pretty very long.

Title: Excellence in Wearable Technology
Content: The Ringconn truly stands out as a masterpiece in wearable technology. Crafted with precision and durability, it exceeds expectations in both design and performance. Its companion phone application is exceptionally well-made, providing seamless integration and regular updates without the need for a subscription. Highly recommended for anyone seeking a reliable and feature-rich smart accessory.

Title: Happy/Sad
Content:
Hello;
Firstly, my experience with the ring was nothing short of great. The metrics it accumulated were very precise. The sad part of this journey is that I lost the ring on a jobsite. It fit wonderfully, though I believe I lost it in a clients heated floor. It has been a month and a bit since it's been lost, and I am struggling with the decision if I will replace it. I tried a silicone cover, but they degraded quickly. I would also suggest a 'find function' on the ring (similar to the find my phone app). Overall, I have nothing but praise for the functionality of the ring, just disappointed that I lost it.

Title: A few minor changes, and it's a 5-star ring.
Content: The Ringconn's extended battery life is an advantage. However, the feature set could benefit from further enhancement. It lacks distinctive features that differentiate it from competitors. Still, the absence of a subscription requirement was a compelling factor in my initial selection of Ringconn as an introduction to smart rings. But, the limited functionality is prompting me to consider alternative options, as it does not fully replace any of my other devices or even limit how much I use them. I would give it five stars if it tracked workouts and shared data with Nike, Samsung, Apple, or other major fitness trackers and somehow notified me of missed calls and texts from specific contacts. It's close to being a great ring, but the lack of features is a big deal.

Title: Ring is pretty accurate on readings
Content: Ring is pretty accurate on readings. I have noticed while awake late at night trying to go back to sleep it records it as light sleep. Other than that, the stress, activity, heart rate, SP02 are all accurate. Holds a charge for several days (maybe 5-7). I've had mine for 6 months now and I'm still happy with it. It's a little cheaper than the other brands too with no membership fees.

Title: Had my doubts
Content: Had my doubts since RingConn was not as well known as competitors. I wanted to find a ring device that did not force me into a paid subscription to view biometrics. At first RingConn’s proprietary software interface required a paradigm shift for me… I now appreciate the info provided, particularly for sleep stages, sleep heart rate and oxygen levels. Been using it daily for at least four months, and I am very impressed. The battery is magic. I use it several days in a row, and the ring typically fully recharges in less than 10 minutes. Then I am good to go for another 6+ days. Used in shower and tested the limits of waterproofness… no issues to date!
CleanText: had my doubts since ringconn was not as well known as competitors i wanted to find a ring device that did not force me into a paid subscription to view biometrics at first ringconns proprietary software interface required a paradigm shift for me i now appreciate the info provided particularly for sleep stages sleep heart rate and oxygen levels been using it daily for at least four months and i am very impressed the battery is magic i use it several days in a row and the ring typically fully recharges in less than minutes then i am good to go for another days used in shower and tested the limits of waterproofness no issues to date

Title: It's fine but it is not good
Content:
The data given by this ring seems fine although it sometimes seems to be somewhat off. It's an everyday ring with few to no use when doing fitness.
The ring is missing the BLE/ANT protocoll to send data like current heartrate or SpO2 to other devices. This would drain the battery faster but would be better for activities and other sleepapps.
The outer material of the ring wears of to fast, while the silicon sleeve to protect the ring is to adhesive.
There is a helpful popup in the app telling when the ring should be reloaded (after about 5 days rather than 7).

Title: Great daily companion with good measurement results
Content: The ring is just great. It wears well and the recordings seem to be correct, with minor deviations. It would be nice if, for example, the color was not so susceptible. I wear the ring every day, but unfortunately the black color has already worn off around the edges. The protective cover simply makes the beautiful ring look like a plastic ring. The battery lasts a very long time and I only have to charge the ring once a week, which is very quick. A great ring despite the minor drawbacks.

Title: My Experience with my Ringconn ring
Content: My first ring arrived in May 2023. By August 2023 the battery life was down to 3 days but after submitting the issue through the app, my ring was replaced. The new ring has been going great. All the functions and data generated match up fairly well with my Fitbit Charge which I have had since 2017. My battery life is still around 6 days. What I wish would be improved is activity tracking for calories burned and heart rate. Currently activity tracking is poor with my ring.

Title: I got the Ring for my spouse
Content: I got the Ring for my spouse. And he told me that after the last software update he nologer gets notifications on when the Ring needs to be charged. The pulse ox is inaccurate. Becasue he has a medical one here and the request we got the Ring was so that way it can Bluetooth to his CPAP. Which it does not. And that's on the CPAP side but the inaccuracy is correct because he won't be able to breath and it's reading him at 95% but put theat home one on and he's at 88%. Maybe a software issue. Other than that everything else is ok. It logs sleep and heart rate excellent and accurate. Including when he takes a nap. Hopefully the next update can get these glitches fixed and a collaboration with all the CPAP machines with Bluetooth will a actually beable to use that function because this really is to monitor he o2 levels while he's sleeping or out and about.

Title: Overall excellent with minor issues
Content: Thoroughly enjoying my ring and the updates are improving an already great experience. I'm actually on my second ring as the first one stopped working fairly early on. Ringconn was great about replacing it and gave me the choice of a new colour. I've had the new ring for 7 months or so and it's been flawless. I run into the occasional problem with the app and their Customer Service always gets back to me within a day or two and are very helpful. Lots of great features and probably the best price out there for what you get... and no monthly fees. I'm very pleased and definitely recommend Ringconn.

Title: This is a competitive priced smart ring but think twice if you have privacy concerns.
Content:
This product is pretty reasonable for its price and not needing a subscription. I would buy it again if I were looking for a smart ring; it's as good as Oura.

The downsides: - The ring protectors are way overpriced and pretty flimsy. - It sketches me out that the app *must* have location data in order for it to display the ring data; it feels like I'm likely being tracked by a foreign government, because I probably am.

Content: I've been using RingConn for about a month now, and it's fantastic. Title: Solid ring hardware and app
Content: Solid ring hardware and app, prompt customer service. Compared to Ultrahuman, the ring is a little bit thicker and feels slightly bulkier, but perfectly fine. The app is more straight to the point and overview-focused, while the Ultrahuman app is organized in "cards" and not as "utilitarian". One caveat: The data upload from ring to app is a little bit slow.

Title: Honestly replaces my smart watch
Content:
Purchase was easy, but I didn't have sizing so got their sizing kit. This caused an overall oddity as the order on their system never really updated well when I provided the size and color I wanted. It instead seemed to get hung up, but support was fantastic and got everything resolved and my ring out to me.

I do wish they had bigger size options though, but I'm a big guy so I'm used to having a hard time with sizing lol

Application is good, widget on my android is pretty decent, and the ring looks and feels good. Battery lasts me on average 5-6 days usually.

Only improvement I can think of after a month+ of wearing it, is that I wish it was a bit different from a simple band looking ring

Title: Innovative, informative but too playful.
Content:
An innovative concept that provides important information. However, it is not very suitable for cycling as the pedometer does not respond precisely to your movements. The evaluations in the new app are appealing and informative. However, I could do without the playful medals. Unfortunately, they devalue the information system somewhat in relation to the game package.
Otherwise I am satisfied. The RIng gives me valuable information about my blood oxygen level, which is important after my pulmonary embolism.

Title: Easy to use, great customer service
Content: Ordering and using this product has been fantastic. I didn't know what size to order so a sizing kit was immediately shipped and I received it within a few days. I decided to order the size that fit on both my index finger AND middle finger (at least that was the plan). There was some confusion about which email I should order under, but I called customer service and they got me fixed up right away. Once I got the ring, it was slightly larger than the sizing sample and only fits snugly in my index finger, but that's ok. I love the information the ring provides and the app is easy to use. I'm fully satisfied.

Title: Do your research to find the best ring for you. This one is a winner for me!
Content: I did a lot of research in finding the smart ring that would work best for me. I decided on the RingConn ring because of the style, color choices and information the RingConn app would provide me. I also didn't want to pay for a subscription service just to use the ring. Before ordering the ring, I was sent a ring size kit. The kit is amazing. It provides enough physical ring sizes to meet everyone's needs. Try one on for 24 hrs and see what fits best before ordering. The ring does exactly what RingConn says it does and does not do. I take a shower with it, sleep with it, along with exercise. The app information has helped me with several changes in my life. From my sleep habits to exercise. I have had the ring about a month now and couldn't have chosen a better smart ring that is currently on the market.

Title: Sleep tracking is suboptimal
Content: The sleep tracking is not very accurate. It allowed me to check some hypothesis and form new ones, such as whether I had sleep apnea, whether sleeping on the side was better for me. But as the timings are off by sometime more than an hour, it's hard to use it to track the effect of small changes.

Title: I love this health tracker
Content:
I love this health tracker! I didn’t want a smart watch, as I have a very nice analog one already, so this was the perfect solution.
I was a bit apprehensive about the quality ( as it was the less expensive version of the ones on the market) but I’m more than impressed with the accuracy, quality and ease of use.

I would say the delivery times could use some improvement, it took almost 4 weeks to receive the Ring sizing kit, had another week to receive the actual Ring itself. I also wish they had a polished version, I have the silver one, and it looks quite dull compared to my other jewellery, however that’s quite an petty observation, given the functionality of the unit.

I love the sleep tracking, it’s really helped me to actively improve the quality of my sleep. I’ve noticed a direct correlation between the number of steps I get each day and the quality of my sleep and HRV.
Absolutely recommend this health tracker to anyone who is looking for a deeper insight on how to improve their overall health .
