Title: Good passive solution
Content:
I am satisfied with the design, the application and the "passive" logic of use. Smart bracelets always annoyed me when they alert me to something, they always want some kind of interaction, the ring is a really great solution in this perspective. Plus I can wear a normal classic analog watch. The ring has a very good battery life and the charging solution is elegant.
I give four stars because the application still needs to develop some functionalities, for example different types of exercises. And you need to realize that the number of measured steps is always a little overestimated (it's logical, every person waves his hand all the time, not only while walking)

Title: Perfect Everyday Device
Content: The ring and accompanying app give great information on my sleep, stress levels, and activity intensity. The app provides the right amount of details and the charts are great at presenting the information in a useful format. I also have a Fitbit Charge 5 and a Garmin Venu 3 and I find the RingConn the best in these categories. Small and unassuming - doesn't get in the way. Runs many days without requiring a charge, and the small charge case is perfect because it doesn't require you to plug into a wall outlet all the time (I have had the ring since February and have yet to recharge the charge case). Would highly recommend this product for those interested in understanding how their body is behaving.

Title: This is the fitness ring to get
Content:
After exhaustively researching the”Big 4” names in fitness rings (Oura, Circular, Ultrahuman and RingConn), I chose RingConn. RingConn was less expensive, had a lot of excellent (and believable) reviews and, perhaps most importantly, has NO MONTHLY SUBSCRIPTION/EXTORTION FEE (which other companies should be absolutely ashamed to charge for such an expensive product). The RingConn ring isn’t quite as nice-looking as some of the others, but it looks absolutely fine, so I have no regrets on that front.

I’ve been wearing the ring for 2+ months. It took a few days for the ring to “get to know” me and provide what appeared to be accurate data, but it has been rock-steady and excellent ever since. The results are consistent with (and I think more accurate than) my Galaxy Watch’s sleep data. (The only thing which confuses both my RingConn and my Galaxy watch is my bed’s vibrating massage function; using it typically results in inaccurate sleep data.). The RingConn app provides detailed information, but is very user-friendly and easy to understand. The few times I found errors in the data (which turned out to be caused by the bed’s massage function), I submitted a ticket through the app and received a satisfactory response within a day. The charging box is the best charging system of any ring; it is super-convenient and works flawlessly. I typically charge the ring every few days while I take a shower just because that’s convenient, but based on the battery level readings in the app, one charge would last 6-7 days.

I’m glad I did so much research before choosing RingConn. This brand seem to be the underdog of fitness rings at the moment, but I would not be surprised if they end up the leader. IMHO, RingConn’s product design, accuracy, price, customer service and pay-once model leave the others in the dust.
CleanText: after exhaustively researching thebig names in fitness rings oura circular ultrahuman and ringconn i chose ringconn ringconn was less expensive had a lot of excellent and believable reviews and perhaps most importantly has no monthly subscriptionextortion fee which other companies should be absolutely ashamed to charge for such an expensive product the ringconn ring isnt quite as nicelooking as some of the others but it looks absolutely fine so i have no regrets on that front ive been wearing the ring for months it took a few days for the ring to get to know me and provide what appeared to be accurate data but it has been rocksteady and excellent ever since the results are consistent with and i think more accurate than my galaxy watchs sleep data the only thing which confuses both my ringconn and my galaxy watch is my beds vibrating massage function using it typically results in inaccurate sleep data the ringconn app provides detailed information but is very userfriendly and easy to understand the few times i found errors in the data which turned out to be caused by the beds massage function i submitted a ticket through the app and received a satisfactory response within a day the charging box is the best charging system of any ring it is superconvenient and works flawlessly i typically charge the ring every few days while i take a shower just because thats convenient but based on the battery level readings in the app one charge would last days im glad i did so much research before choosing ringconn this brand seem to be the underdog of fitness rings at the moment but i would not be surprised if they end up the leader imho ringconns product design accuracy price customer service and payonce model leave the others in the dust

Title: It seems to make the data up
Content:
Initially all seemed well. Long wait to receive the ring during the Kickstarter campaign, but the company tried to keep people updated, even though their own spreadsheet didn't match up with delivery volumes and dates.
After wearing the ring for a few months, I've been receiving worrying heart rate data of very high heart rate. These figures didn't match up at all with a smart watch readings, or an external blood pressure monitor.
Heart rate around 60bpm, ring sometimes records resting heart rate 170-220bpm. During these high heart rate recording other devices track a higher heart rate of 80-100bpm, but no where near the figures RingConn records. And these are not brief blips of a minute or two, but 30-60 minute periods.
I have contacted RingConn on a few occasions, sending them data showing the high reading and just receive a standard copy and paste reply, basically fobbing me off, saying they are aware of high heart rate readings and updating software/algorithms to correct the issue, which never seems to happen.
As for the rest of the data the ring provides, the sleep figures can be way off as well, which is the only other metric I can verify. And as I've got no way of checking the rest of the data, I've got no way of confirming how accurate it is.
RingConn keep updating the design of the app, which is pointless if the data it shows isn't accurate.
Basically, don't buy a RingConn ring, it'll be money wasted.

Title: I went from a fitbit to Oura and now to…
Content: I went from a fitbit to Oura and now to Ring Conn, very very happy!! It has the step accuracy of fitbit, Oura is not even close to being an accurate step counter. This ring automatically recognizes exercise and then rates the level of exercise accurately! Plus, you can't just add a workout and cheat this setup, it knows when your working out. With fitbit or Oura you can manually add the workout which then inflates your heart rate and gives you workout credit whether you actually worked out or not?? Oura is slow to recognize stress, this ring is spot on all the time! This is the only ring that gives you 24hr automatic heart rate, spo2 and hrv readings all the time that is super accurate and then gives you an ongoing average all day and night of those metrics! Come on everyone, please realize your HRV is the epicenter of all of your workout or just normal recovery from anything your doing! This ring nails it even when compared to my chest strap that measures my HRV and I can see it at a glance anytime, wherever I am! The information pages are like no other app with ongoing averages to all your other metrics and a trend format like no other. I am surprised there is no monthly charge for this app. I bought the silver and it is a beautiful ring, matte finish in the center to a polished surface on the edges, very durable too. If I listened to all the marketing bs comparing this ring to the others, I might not have bought this ring, just buy it and enjoy, it is truly the best!!

Title: Very Dissatisfied Customer
Content: I ordered a ring from RingConn after researching many different ones. I did not pick the "I don't know my size" as I have a ring sizer at home and I know my ring size. However, once I received my ring and wore it for 3 days my 2nd knuckle on my pointer finger was sore and bruised; however the ring itself fit. I have long skinny fingers so the width of the ring takes up the entire area from the end of my finger where it touches my hand to the 2nd knuckle (I ordered the ring to fit both index fingers along with both pointer fingers). I have 2 autoimmune disorders that affect my joints and cause pain so sometimes I am unsure how something with affect my skin, joints, and be comfortable for me until I get and wear it. This happened once I wore the ring. I emailed the RingConn less than a week of receiving and wearing the ring explaining the situation and was told my circumstance does not allow for returns and I could either continue to wear it (even though I told them it is painful and causing bruises) or I could gift it to someone. So, I am now going to be out the money the ring cost along with having to purchase another tracker of some kind. I received absolutely no assistance from the company whatsoever. I do understand that I chose the the ring size and like I said it does fit but there are things that I cannot always plan for with having autoimmune disorders which is partly the reason why I chose their product as it would track some health measures I needed and wanted.

Title: Very Satisfied User
Content:
I have been using my RingConn for about a month now and it has been very helpful in monitoring my health. I purchased it specifically for the sleep tracking since I can’t stand to wear my bulky Apple Watch to sleep. The sleep tracking data is very thorough and complete and gives a score every night on the quality of your sleep which I find helpful at a glance to see how it went. As far as the fitness tracking and heart rate I wear both ring and watch during the day and both get the same (or very similar) results so I believe that the fitness data the ring collects is pretty accurate. I have a friend with the Oura ring and have compared data with them and the RingConn records the same data without the need for a paid subscription which is a great feature. Also I think that the RingConn’s detailed sleep data is more inclusive than what the Oura is able to provide. Overall I’m very happy with my ring and I find it so easy to wear I forget it’s there!

Just an FYI the shipping takes a very long time to arrive but that’s ok I was able to communicate with support and was reassured that it was on the way and not lost.

Title: Brilliant health monitoring device
Content:
Have loved this ring from moment I started wearing it.
Love all the features, it's comfortable and gives me so much information.
Longest part of the process was receiving the sizing kit, but actusl ring arrived within a few days.
Started using it straight away. I have a Samsung phone and it has paired nicely. I have a Samsung smart watch and a Tag one and have to say the ring is hands down better!
There are no monthly fees like some others, which made me favour this particular one after a lot of research, and I'm glad I did. The app that links the ring to your phone is probably one of the best apps around, the battery is superb and my ring lasts almost a full week before I have to recharge it... then it fully recharges within about 1 hour in the lovely wee case it came in.
My daily summary gives me not only sleep and stress info by each hour but also gives me my activity and steps. It compares day to day for activity, stress, sleep, heart rate, and activity calories plus more.
I am a real tech gadget person and this genuinely is one of the best products around for monitoring your health.
I love this ring so much my wife will be getting one for Christmas 😀

Title: Health tracking ring
Content:
The thing I love most about my RingConn ring is that it doesn't look like a tech device, it simply looks good.
On top of that it's very light and I don't feel that it's on my finger. The brushed gold looks beautiful.

Great that there is no monthly fee to get access to your data.

The ring is water resistant and I don't have to worry washing hands, doing dishes, showering, swimming or jumping in sea.

The RingConn app is very intuitive to use. And the company is constantly working on new features to implement. They have made some changes to the app so it's more functional.

I love the activity/daily calories & step count. It helps to see how active you need to be to maintain or lose weight.
The sleep tracking is very accurate and so is the heartrate and stress score tracking. (Compared to other wearables and medical equipement)
Bonus is the sleep temp.

The company is constantly updating the app and the RingConn firmware.
Making positive changes to help improve the product so it gets to be even better. They actually listen to their users. There have been several positive changes since I started using my ring about 4 months ago.

Great device for health tracking.

Title: Ringconn rings are great
Content:
I made a purchase in January of my very own ringconn ring. The app has been a great work in progress. We find a bug, they fix it. This is the first time a beta group has been so active. Now that the bugs have been worked out they just keep.maling improvements in the software. This wing has been great.

The astetics of the ring
The ring simply looks great. There is comfort and quality to put into the ring and makes me feel like they care about the product. They keep releasing the accessories and seem to put a lot of thought into them as well. I am so pleased with this product.

Cost.
At 279.00 it's a great deal. The other companies in the ring market are about the same price but don't offer the same matrix. They also (some) charge a monthly fee. The ringconn company has said a number of times they will not have a monthly fee, and they haven't.

I love my ring and am so happy I invested in it

Title: Phantastic
Content:
Well, I am an early supporter of the idea, loving that subscription free solution.

I am usually wearing mechanical watches only, thus the ring supposed to be my device.

Update: the ring came right before the holiday season and is now in constant use, on the beach (salty atlantico), sweet water pool and on all other occasions.

I have been a bit skeptical lately after seeing the offer of a silicon protection cover; that maybe sand could damage the surface, scratching and so on.

Well, I have ordered the protecting ring but so far I don't have any complaints, even though the ring faces tough conditions, heat, sun, salt water etc..

I am very happy about the data the ring provides, data enabling me to have objective insights into (body/health) facts instead of feelings.

Beside the insights (and data means power in regard to our core asset, life), the ring looks stunning and can be worn without having a smartphone nearby as data will be synced later on.

Well, that's one of the best purchases I have ever made and it's going to boost knowledge about my body and supports me on my way to take even better care of myself, for me and my loved once.

Thumbs up.

Title: Two time loser
Content: This is my second go-round with RingConn. I was in the original backer group, waited months and months, then finally got my ring. I was delighted because the app was so good, but it stopped pairing after two days and wouldn't power up at all. I sent it back. Months later, the replacement arrived and the same thing happened. Two days of wearing it and it stopped pairing, then refused to power up. These rings come from China, so who knows what's going on. All I know is that I am out a couple hundred bucks for a ring that's more or less bricked.

Title: Finally a serious contender in the health ring arena
Content:
I just received my order of a gorgeous black RingConn and I have to say how impressed I am with the quality of work that has gone into creating this ring. From its packaging to functionality, fit and esthetics, this health tracking ring beats the front runner in this field, hands down. For example it can measure blood SpO2 saturation index continuously 24/7, something that even the Oura ring can not do without draining the battery and talk about battery, I just LOVE the charging box that comes with it, a subtle (and functional) addition that no other similar smart ring, has. The ring charges from almost no charge, within an hour or so and the charge lasts for a good 6-7 days.
The app is also a work of art and packed with live and historical health data and other information. You can just tell that a massive amount of work has gone into creating RingConn app alone.
RingConn also has built in temperature sensors and will soon activate the feature with an app update to measure core body temperature too. It currently only measures "Skin Temperature"during sleep, and again another feature that Oura doesn't have.
As for accuracy, I have checked the SpO2 and Sleep data against my medical grade Oximeter and my ZEO EKG device. The results are within 2% of each other. In contrast my Oura Ring results are within a 6% margin of error which makes the RingConn an undisputed winner in accuracy, as far as I am concerned.
I would definitely recommend it.

Title: Worked well
Content: RingConn smart ring provides comprehensive and detailed health tracking without any subscription fees. I have been using it for over 5 months, and each update has enhanced the overall experience. Title: I was in the original purchase group of…
Content:
I was in the original purchase group of RingConn. My first experiences with the ring were fantastic, much better than Oura. The HRV was all day and not just during sleep and it was accurate. The step counter was also accurate. The heart rate was not only accurate but continuous.

Then the ring simply stopped working. One night I woke up and there was no sleep data and no HRV data. This happened multiple times. I wrote to the company and received back a message obviously written by somebody who didn't speak English very well. Because I've had the ring for a few months, I cannot get my money back. So I put the Oura ring back on my finger and chalked this up to the normal fraud mongers who are out there looking to take our money.

Caveat emptor: Be careful of this company. Once a tracking device misses one day there is never a reason to wear it again. This ring has possibilities but isn't ready for prime time. Expect it to stop working and then expect customer service to write you back and talk to you like English is their sixth language.

Content:

Content:

I had the Oura ring but, not happy with it plus the subscription put me off even more

The app is really developing and now night time temperature working thats brilliant
Overall I love this ring I don’t need my watch at night, it lasts 6-7 days on one charge, it has a charging case with 18 charges in it so no wires required
Keep up the great work RingConn you should be proud to produce a brilliant ring that I love

Title: RingConn is much better than Oura
Content:
I have been wearing RingConn for a week now. I really like this!

I had Oura before. I have to admit that Oura is good for sleep tracking but 7$ in a month for subscription fee is too much. As a matter of principle i unsubscribed and i also sold my Oura.

I can compare RingConn sleep tracking to my Apple watch. I have to say that i believe RingConn more than Apple watch.

RingConn steps calcularor is working too. You can see walking distance. Oura’s steps wasnt working. I also like RingConn’s stress monitoring and also all the other features too. I dont miss Oura at all.

Some users complaining about scratches. Well… my Oura got so scratched that they changed my ring (warranty). Of course these can get scratches in hard use like phones watches etc. You can use wrap paper or something if you like to cover your ring.

Somebody said that Facebook admin and community are toxic. Well.. my experience is the opposite. Community helps each other and admins are there too. They also help people with their problems. I sent email to RingConn and they replied at the same day.

Overall:
I really recommend RingConn. Better looking than Oura. These guys updating app/ring and i have a feeling that they take this project seriously. Even more features than Oura (example stress monitoring). No monthly subscription fee and also RingConn is cheaper than Oura.

Content:
I compared the ring with multiple other trackers like Oura, Polar, Xiaomi, Whoop and a medical grade SpO2 sensor.

Title: Hard working company with a exellent product !
Content:
This is a fairly young company with a lot of ambition, knowleage and will to produce high quality Health Tracking Rings.
I've communicated with them numerous times through their costumer service and have always got a fast, polite answer to my questions within a day.
I was a Indiegogo backer to their Health Tracking Ring and my sizing kit arrived quickly.
When I recieved my ring, I was firstly amazed over the premium presentation box it was delivered in and the ring itself is built with care, precision and the look of the ring is exclusive, to say the least.
The app is very pedagogical built and holds a ton of information recived from the ring. It's very easy to read the info from a summary on the first page of the app before diving in to the details.
I highly recommend anyone to do business with this company and their Health Tracker Ring is an amazing product.

Title: Very Pleased!
Content:
I was one of the first 20 backers of this IndieGoGo kickstarter campaign and have no regrets whatsoever. Received my sizing kit and ultimately my ring in the timeframe promised by RingConn. This company is EXTREMELY proactive and the communication with their backers has been EXTRAORDINARY.

The app software and ring firmware are works in progress, however, I’m not a fussy person as I see RingConn putting a lot of time and effort into development.

Sadly, the negative reviews on here are ridiculous at best with RingConn not deserving the negativity as they’ve been ALWAYS upfront and transparent with their backer unlike any other kickstarter campaign I know of.

My experience has been positive and some of the data has been extremely accurate but also know with this first generation ring that it will get better over time. What people need to know is smartwatches and smart rings are NOT medical devices but are excellent for baseline numbers only.

Title: Really an amazing wearable health device
Content: From the moment I got this amazing ring I have loved it. Right now I struggle with stress and sleep, so I decided on this ring. I have an Apple watch but it does not give me as much information as this ring. There are no monthly fees like some those other rings have. The app that links the ring to your phone is probably one of the best apps around. My ring lasts almost a full week before I have to recharge it. And it only takes about an hour to get it fully recharged. I received my ring in February so I have been wearing it every day since. Honestly, I don't even wear my Apple watch anymore since I got this ring. It gives me so much info on the times in the day my stress level rises so I can try to control those times better. I really like all of the information it gives me about what my heart and breath rhythms are doing throughout the night. My daily summary gives me not only my sleep and stress info by each hour in also gives me my activity and steps. It compares my day to day for activity, stress, sleep, heart rate, and activity calories plus more. This is really one of the best products around for monitoring your health. I love this ring so much I bought one for my husband.

Title: The best customer service I ever saw!
Content: Im one of the first bakers who ordered the ring. As promised I got my ring in February. The ring do everything it should be: activity (steps, heart rate, HRV etc.), stress levels, sleep monitoring (with respiratory rate and SpO2 or naps during the day). You can also measure SpO2 or heart rate manually. The App is simple and has a nice overview. For 2 months there were 3 updates including Apple Health/ Google Fit integration. And soon temperature measurement is coming. RingConn provides service never seen from another company: they answer all the customers questions, send info emails, make even personal interviews so they can improve every day. You get much more for what you paid! I can only recommend!

Title: Best smart ring on the market!!
Content:
This ring works, unlike some others out there. RingConn came to crowdfunding ready to deliver and they have. I had another ring briefly and despite being a market leader, I had horrible customer service from them and had to send that ring back.
This ring is absolutely amazing. Yes it's a startup company, yes this is the first generation ring, but this is by far the most responsive company I have ever seen.
They're just they're not just shipping any old thing like some are, they are shipping live working rings, and they are working every day to make them better.
We've had software updates, we've had firmware updates, they have multiple channels for people who've received their rings already to submit issues and they're working on them and fixing them and they're putting serious effort into making this the best smart ring out there. If I had gotten a tenth of this support from that other company, I might still have that ring.
I thought smart rings were a great idea from when I first heard of them, I can't wear the watches comfortably because my wrists are too small, and I'm absolutely thrilled with this product. It is lightweight, and fits well And it does a great job of what it's supposed to. Someone else has posted on here all the things it does, so I'm not going to list them again, and I'll admit all of the readings are not 100% perfect yet, but since I've had mine, I've seen it get better and better and better. I keep thinking I want to get one from another company just to be able to compare them, but so far, there's no one out there that even comes close to being worth bothering with.
If you're thinking of getting a smart ring, this is the one. This ring is actually in production, and being shipped. It is not a pie in the sky fantasy like some of the other ones being sold are and there's no monthly subscription fee, so they're not trying to do a money grab. These rings are being shipped, and they are working.

Title: The company says they are in Delaware…
Content:
The company says they are in Delaware United states they are not.

I ordered in December of 2022, at the time. They said they are in production mode with local delivery in February.

In January the sizing kit arrived, and that apparently fulfilled the pledge. Ring has not yet shipped, and they have said, we meant to say shipping starts after Feb.

Of the 7100 backers from Dec around 900 have received rings.

The rest get to run around the company is actually out of china. They are currently under investigation from Indegogo for violation of crowdfunding rules.

They are extremely aggressive at removing all negative reviews on social media. Anyone says anything negative or complains about the ring. Gets the post deleted as hate speech.

They have now said they will ship another 1500 sometime in the next few weeks (maybe)

They say so many contradicting things its incredible.

So far most people getting black rings.. are showing they are easily scratched.

Sleep data is way off, and seams to be generic. A few users posted screen shots. Showing they had the exact same sleep data.

Issues reported with steps.

They advertise they do body temp, but now say its not actually enabled at this time. And will be at a later date.

But is still listed as a feature.

I would avoid this Chinese company that is pretending to be a US company at all costs.

Title: RingConn Smart Ring
Content:
Spotted this ring on indigogo site in Nov 2022 was a bit wary of buying as some company’s do not always deliver
But from purchasing the product they stated deliveries estimated Feb/March 2023 if I remember rightly
They gave lots of updates and within a month I received my sizing ring December 2022 and the Ring in February 6 2023
Wow what a piece of technology well worth the money it does exactly same as the Oura ring but no subscription.
They say 7 day battery life had it on for 7 days and still 19% battery and took 1 hour to recharge to 100% so really impressed , also it has portable charging case good for vacations. I
The company have been very good on answering any questions on messenger
All readings on the app are quite good couple small glitches but there ironing them out,
I have compared it to my Apple Watch and very similar only this does a great deal more
On the ring the sizing kit I picked size 12 and when the ring come size 12 it was actually comfier than the sizing ring.
If anyone thinking of getting a smart ring I highly recommend this one absolutely love it even picks up when I have a nap
These are the charts in the app
Couple small bugs with app but to be expected it’s really improved since last update and another one due very soon also noticed they do have offices in Delaware as found on internet search

CleanText: spotted this ring on indigogo site in nov was a bit wary of buying as some companys do not always deliver but from purchasing the product they stated deliveries estimated febmarch if i remember rightly they gave lots of updates and within a month i received my sizing ring december and the ring in february wow what a piece of technology well worth the money it does exactly same as the oura ring but no subscription they say day battery life had it on for days and still battery and took hour to recharge to so really impressed also it has portable charging case good for vacations i the company have been very good on answering any questions on messenger all readings on the app are quite good couple small glitches but there ironing them out i have compared it to my apple watch and very similar only this does a great deal more on the ring the sizing kit i picked size and when the ring come size it was actually comfier than the sizing ring if anyone thinking of getting a smart ring i highly recommend this one absolutely love it even picks up when i have a nap these are the charts in the app couple small bugs with app but to be expected its really improved since last update and another one due very soon also noticed they do have offices in delaware as found on internet search temperature tracking due soon heart rate heart rate variability steps sp walking distance nap duration sleep sp time asleep deep sleep duration stress score sleep score sleep heart rate sleep hrv activity score active calories activity duration respiratory rate m v intensity sleep respiring rate rem duration light sleep duration time in bed early morning stress morning stress afternoon stress basal metabolism total calories standing duration sleeping efficiency subjective sleep score time awake inactive duration low intensity duration moderate intensity duration vigorous intensity duration evening stress relax stress time normal stress time medium stress time high stress time temperature coming soon its built in just perfecting logarithm they say overall stars great company to deal with update since last update sleep data improved the app has improved the company very responsive to answering questions and even put live link to talk to people about the ring on facebook page very responsive to questions made enquiries and yes there is a office in delaware for tax purposes and in use theres lots offices in that area for this issue apple health is now integrated into the app end of april for temperature addition sleep manual alteration added to app so you can set time to bed and up again aeroplane mode added in app and many more features coming soon overall this ring and the app are improving with every updates
